text: Probably the best tasting food at PHX. However, $9.00 for chips and salsa after I've already bought beer and appetizers is a bad, bad thing. There are enough negative reviews about this specific subject (read below) that the management should take notice and at least make chips and salsa complementary as long as the customer has purchased something.

had a $20 slow cooked pork dish (cochinito pibil) that was described as a house speciality.  Nothing special.  Salty, a little dry...lots of spices. Obvious sauce drips on plate rim were partially wiped off...made the plate look unapetizingly dirty at first.  The $7 Modelo tasted great!
Best pork burrito I've ever had. Best airport meal ever! Hope to fly through PHX again just to get one!

First time trying Barrio Cafe and so glad we did thanks to a long layover at Phoenix airport. The Paso Poblano tacos & burrito were both the best we've ever had!!! Moist and nicely seasoned chicken and sauce with goat cheese (no rice/beans) :). Far from the usual gut bomb at other Mexican restaurants. Of course it's on the pricey side but well worth it. Serves fresh coffee made in a French press. The caramel filled Churros made the perfect finishing touch! Great service too! Highly recommended. We'll definitely dine there again on our next trip... time permitting.

I wanted to grab a quick bite before flying back to LA.  Service here could hardly be described as quick here, nor could it be described as accurate.  I never did get my drink order that day; not even a glass of water.

Great place. I just got back from Mexico and ate the tacos there and I ordered the steak tacos here and it was the exact same. True, authentic stuff. Guacamole looked great and salsa was fresh. Only problem was the 9$ chips and salsa and 14$ for 3 tacos. But that's Sky Harbor airport for ya
Very good food for the airport if you like spicy get the salsa, house ketchup, or the chorizo. The pick de gallo is really good too.

Pros: Not jam packed, service was quick and professional.  Cons: came here specifically for a bloody "Maria". Ordered a double (wife did too). Tasted good, but I'm pretty sure they gypped us on the alcohol as neither of us felt one bit different when we finished them. Thus the disappointing rating.

Did the right thing and checked Yelp before choosing.  No seating at first choice, so took a chance on the lesser option here.  What a mistake. Sub par service and sub par food.  Chips and salsa - chips were thick fried so hard i ripped my mouth up on them. Salsa was good, but salsa is very hard to screw up. $9. Ordered the spicy seasoned chicken sandwich. Bread wasn't fresh and required some shearing strength to complete the only bite i took.  Went looking for salvageable contents - chicken breast was thin sliced in half, no flavor. Bunch of onions that i carefully read the ingredients to avoid. Steak fries were cold. Spicy ketchup was the best thing on the plate.  I'm writing this review from next door at La Grande Orange where I'm enjoying the well reviewed Kale salad... Should have listened to my fellow Yelpers and saved $33 wasted next door.
The chips and salsa were simply bad at any price but at $9.00 it was insulting. Plus the $18 glass of wine - what a rip-off. As a Phoencian, I'm ashamed that this is what's offered to visitors.

Had a friend recommend this place to me while I was in town on business.  He mentioned that Sky Harbor is attracting great chef-driven operations to place their restaurants in the airport.  But he thought I wouldn't be able to get to Barrio Cafe because it was only available behind the D Gates (Terminal 3) security check and I was going to Terminal 3, but was behind the US Airways security check (B Gates.)  I figured that sounded wrong, and had 3 hours to kill before my flight so I started exploring.  To my surprise, I found that I could make the long hike, and after about 30-45 minutes of horizontal escalators, a cappuccino from Cartel Coffee Lab, and a near-taco purchase at *another* place, a dude drove by on one of those people carriers and offered me a lift.  2 minutes later and I'm standing ten feet from Barrio.  First, had to wait about ten minutes to get a seat.  I could've sat immediately in the bar, but needed to do some work on the laptop.  Finally got a seat, and perused the menu.  It was short and sweet...and a bit expensive.  Average price around $15 for a plate of tacos, etc.  Specials over $20 each.  I order the Cochinita Pibil tacos with fries.    The tacos were amazing.  Two or three homemade corn tortillas around each helping of juicy pork.  They left the pork nude and let the arbol/sour marinade and slow-cook do the flavor work.  Then they top it with their pickled onions and a habanero sauce and pico de gallo,...or was the habanero inside the pico de gallo?  Either way it was hot, perfectly cooked juicy pork, and exploded with flavor.  They also give you this side of "yellow" salsa.  I try some of it on my 3rd bite.  Their chef knows what's up.  The yellow was a cooling agent, that basically cleanses the palate and cools your tongue for the next bite.  Balance and complexity like this is hard to find.   Three tacos later and I am fully satisfied and very impressed.  I couldn't finish the fries, but they were crispy, hot, and lightly salted with what I'd imagine was arbol powder or maybe just cayenne and salt? (I forget)  While the dish was expensive, the portions were generous and the quality was well worth it.  If this was the airport location, I can't wait to try their original storefront operation when I'm back in town.

Lunch on a layover. Menu looked better than most airport fare. A little pricey but typical airport prices. I had the shrimp tacos. Good size shrimp with good spicy flavors. The salsa Verde was good as well. Pretty impressed for an airport. Service was good but a little slow in the beginning. I can imagine the actual downtown restaurant is quite good.

Surprisingly good for airport food - not only was the food good, the beer was tall for the price and the service was fast and very friendly.  Finally an airport restaurant where you leave feeling full and not ripped off!
Crap wine selection served in dirty glasses. The food was good, but the dirty glass makes me wonder if the plate was even clean. Great fast service so I have to give them some credit.

Grabbed dinner there as I was passing through the Phoenix Airport.  The cafe is good, services very good and surpassed my expectations.  Food was good, definitely would go back again if I have the time as I make my connections.  Price was good, and as I have traveled many airports, it was reasonable, good portions.  I'll make there again.
Wow!  So impressive for airport food. I got shrimp quesadilla's (not what they are called on menu). Fantastic, gourmet, Mexican. Mmmmmm go there!

They don't realize they are in an airport an people are in a hurry. Our waitress was constantly distracted with having to whip up fresh guacamole instead of serving her customers. 20 minutes for $15 tacos that I have to shove down my face in order to make my flight was not enjoyable.

We have been traveling all day, and all we wanted was a decent meal that wasn't fast food. We were going to wait until we got home, but when our flight was delayed, we couldn't wait.  We really didn't want airport food at all. We were pleasantly surprised! Quick service, lots of great flavor and filling. I had the pollo pablano and pasole. My husband had the pork tacos. It was definitely better than our expectations.

Good place to eat if you want fresh Mexican food! Disturbing scene yesterday with a bunch of grown men trying to bully the staff for cheap drinks.  Made an uncomfortable scene for other patrons.  Heard they were a bunch of rugby players..old rugby players! Just sad. One was actually pushing his finger into one of the staffs chest trying to intimidate him.  The staff handled it pretty well. The guy is lucky he didn't get arrested!! So as long as you don't have grown men being bullies and making a scene, it's a great place to kill time between flights!
Wow... To have the same name of a great restaurant and deliver an experience that is subpar to say the least is an incredible let down. Expensive, cold and just disappointing.
Sat at the bar - good service. Had the steak tacos - pretty good. Draft beer - 20 oz. Total = $20. I left full and not broke in the airport. I'd go back.

For airport food, this was pretty decent. Ordered fish tacos and they brought me shrimp. Waitress felt bad and brought me two extra fish tacos, so I could taste them. AND AND they are hardly selfish with the avocado! I got over a 4th of an avocado on each taco. Do the math!   The waitress was helpful and extremely friendly.    And don't get me started on the margarita! Don Julio Cadillac Margarita, and MAN! It was RIGHT! She was not selfish with the tequila and I sure appreciated that!   I will DEFINITELY try again.

I know Barrio is all the Food Network rage, so I can only speak on the airport location. In a nutshell, the breakfast food was disappointing. The menu itself is condensed which I understand, but this leaves little to no room for variation and flavor. I ordered the Chilaquiles Verde and when it arrived to the table: a few soggy, stale chips, with a few pieces of pork, and two bland eggs. Seriously, there was no flavor and barely any pork. The two stars accounts for the server who was nice and prompt, the coffee (pressed), and the decor. We killed some time but really should have grabbed a bagel and coffee, and saved the dollars.
Average but expensive airport food. Had the pork burrito, it was salty and uninspiring.
This place had the worst Mexican food I've ever had. Overpriced, greasy, and tasteless. Avoid the horchata.

Stopped here for breakfast on my back to South TX. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. The chorizo con huevos was outstanding! Excellent Mexican food, particularly in an airport! Definitely recommend this place to weary travelers tired of overpriced, bland airport food. Thumbs up!

Barrio cafe in Phoenix airport... What scatter brain corporate executive in charge of this place green lighted and ok'd the use of jalapeno peppers in ALL repeat ALL the hash browns??? So your kids will be screaming/crying for mercy with one bite. And there's not even a warning... Just some idiotic "our famous barrio browns" in the menu description. Wake up and fire some CEO's please and fix your menu. Also the food was horrible. $30 at the airport for two breakfasts that weren't even as good as Mc Donalds or Burger king breakfast. You people should be ashamed. I didn't know that it was even possible to screw eggs, bacon and hash browns up this bad. My advice would be to avoid this place at all costs. A microwave breakfast burrito that has been frozen since Abraham Lincoln was born would be better. Run for your life.

Americanized Mexican.   No beans, no rice, and apparently no fresh guacamole. The menu claims that the guacamole is prepared "table side". Instead I received what I would classify as a cereal-bowl-sized serving. This cereal bowl came out appearing to be thrown together at some point during the day (hopefully) and then tossed into the fridge until some ill informed customer orders this $12.50 "fresh" not fresh dish.  How can an airport in such a Mexican affluent area serve "Mexican" dishes over...fries...?

Food was ok, waiter forgot the beer I ordered.   Also, he picked up 5-6 cups from different tables at once and asked who wanted refills. Not too weird, but cup came back to me with a chewed straw in it. Not mine. Who knows if the cup was.

The positive: it was fast. The negative: God awful chicken tacos. Came soaking in juice at the bottom the plate. The tortillas completely ripped apart when you picked them up and all I could taste was watery goat cheese. Salad was crammed in a tiny bowl so it just fell out all over when you tried to get a bite. Find another option for eating. Not worth it. I would say hands down, worst tacos I've ever had.

Was hungry on the way out of PHX so stopped here.  Margarita - yum.  Food - came out cold.  Came back again was luke warm.  The guy next to me said hi steak was not that warm either.  Would move this review to four stars if they heated their plates!  Service: pretty good actually.  At least for me.  Just get drinks and colder items like guac or salad.

Usually airport restaurants don't stand out, but Barrio Cafe in the D gate area definitely does. When I have a layover in Phoenix I go out of my way to eat there. Food is excellent and service always fast, friendly and efficient. I always make a point to order their French Press coffee. It is the best coffee I've ever had. Barrio is worth the long walk from the C gates.

Good drinks-not horribly overpriced.  GREAT drink specials - $11 for a 20oz GOOD beer and a shot of anything!  Can't beat that!!!  Friendly bartenders and decent food.    You know, what can you REALLY expect from an airport restaurant.  You don't go for the food.  If you're really hungry enough to eat at the airport, then don't expect 4 star restaurant quality.... and don't judge the airport restaurants as such.   This really is the only bar/restaurant option in the Southwest terminal.  I found a security guard and asked about some of the other restaurants in the airport and was told that unless you want to make the 20-30 minute hike around security to get around to some of the other gates, you should just stay put.  I'm actually glad he suggested this- even though I had a 3 hour layover.  The menu LOOKS impressive... but again, remember where you are.  I did happen to be starving and needed a little something to soak up the drinks I would be consuming during my loooong layover.  I ordered the poblano burritto.  For an airport burrito it wasn't bad- but it was slightly lacking in flavor.  I asked for something to add some spice and they provided me with three different kinds of salsa to try, which did make it a little better.    What most impressed me was the service.  The bartenders and servers were all upbeat and smiley- very friendly and definitely created a welcoming atmosphere.  The drinks were not HORRIBLY over- priced and now if you order a beer, you can add a shot of ANYTHING for $4!  I got a shot of Don Julio (which might normally be at least $10+) so ended up paying $11 for a 20oz Modelo Especial and excellent tequila.    And other reviewers were right.... this is definitely a great place for eye candy!  All the hotties seem to flock here...
Mediocre food. Takes FOREVER. avoid if you don't have time to linger.

I hate Yelp.  I detest that people would rather sit through a bad restaurant experience than be proactive on the spot, get a manager and make things instantly better. Instead, they fester in their car ride home and then critique what could have been fixed.  Because of this I don't get too negative and slam places... normally.  That being said guys, this was terrible and you need to 1. know about it  2.  fix it.  There were three people at your bar on a slow Thursday morning.  There were two bartenders, someone doing inventory and digging through the coolers and some other random staff on the floor.  The service was absolutely and completely non-existent.  Zero sense of urgency - at an airport none the less.  The employees were seemingly staring off into space and having random conversations with each other -  completely ignoring customers, tickets, bussing dirty plates, etc...  I have been in the industry for over 20 years and the anxiety I felt because the place was running so poorly was overwhelming.  The three of us at the bar, all complete strangers, were looking at each other in disbelief.  I guarantee we are all still talking about how frustrated we were.  A keg blew when this poor guy finally got some attention and the tap exploded foam all over him, only to be told by the bartender that "it happens all the time".  He got his beer 7 minutes later - a restaurant eternity.  Come on guys - I know it's an airport but it's still your name and you have to get some attention down there.

I would only recommend this place for the drinks! I find it odd that a Mexican food place doesn't sell chips and salsa or beans! The main side for food is fries!!! It's really weird! I think they should rethink their menu!' For this reason I give them 2 stars!  I had a chicken spinach salad and it was decent!

This place seems super cute when you walk in. Then boom the bad attitude behind the bar hits you. No smile, and you are greeted with a "your going to have to take your purse off the bar....it is a health code violation".What a joke. The purse on the bar,not a health code violation. The 1/4 inch of dust on your beers taps, now that is a health violation. Dropping in every beer you pour. Which I probably would not have been looking at if you had greeted me with a hello and a simple smile. Employ people who love what they do!

I haven't even gotten my food(to go) yet, but they gave my order to someone else, then made it with the wrong side, and now I'm hoping I make my flight.  Folks standing to order while a gal stands playing with her phone in fruit of them.  Idiots.

I love Barrio Cafe in the Barrio on 16th St, but the airport location is leaving. I was seated for 7 minutes, completely ignored by the wait staff and I got up to leave. A manager in a dress shirt had told someone would be by but he didn't seem bothered when he saw me leaving later. Oh well. I get seated much better at the real Barrio (16th St and Thomas). One would think they would be faster at the airport. I wouldn't go to the airport location unless you have a couple hours until your flight.  I love Chef Silvana, but this location is a dud.

The food was good, I had pork tacos. Even my waitress Schilee was great! Why only 3 stars? The hostesses were THAT bad. Snobby to the max. One wouldn't put her iPhone down even while seating people! And when two ladies asked for a different table than where she tried to seat them? She handed them their menus and made them seat themselves and walked off annoyed with them. It was so bad I'm docking two stars.
Don't come for large portions. Food was good quality but a bit pricey. Service was rushed and inattentive.
The food is bland and the drinks are expensive, If this doesn't bother you it's an ok spot to hang out between flights with a few flat screens to entertain you.

I decided to try the Barrio Cafe at the airport on Thanksgiving morning before my flight and I received the absolute rudest service I have been a witness too.  The man who served me should not be in the customer service business.  That kind of service is bad for business and really is an embarrassment to the brand.

This place was terrible. Extremely overpriced, even for airport food. Ordered chips and salsa for $9. Was basically a basket with like 30 chips in it. Margarita was served in a tiny glass, basically a small cocktail glass full of ice with a splash of mixer. Service was rude, almost laughed when we commented on the menu, basically said "yea we can charge whatever we want" I mentioned the small glass full of ice they called a margarita, basically told that's how it is. The host at the front was almost annoyed we even showed up, wouldn't even acknowledge us arriving. So we proceeded to walk to a table then suddenly she's interested and barks at where we think we are going......save yourself the time and just walk elsewhere. You'll be glad you did.

Horrible customer service. Our expectations at any airport are not high - many travelers are hurried, lost, rude, etc. understandably it's a tough job. If you are feeling up to being ignored from the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out, this is the place! The Barrio cafe in the Phoenix airport seems to have perfected "the annoying customer" role to a tee. Don't even try to be polite unless you have the overwhelming desire to pay a lot of money for what looked to be "ok" food and treated like a nuisance. Can't comment on the food as we walked out. I give them an A+ for perfecting horrible customer service, however they will not be getting my $$$.
$14 burrito with south of France ingredients. Uh, HELLO, were in a recession!

Pros: Drinks are good. Cons: Breakfast was cold (twice), and expensive.  We were early for a flight and stopped in for breakfast and a marg.  Breakfast came out cold.  We asked for them to pop the meals in the microwave for a minute, and would have been happy with that.  Instead, they remade the meals, which again came out cold.  By this point, we didn't have much time before our flight, so we ate some of the food, then left.  The manager was nice and apologetic, but nothing was comp'd and our meal with 2 drinks each cost about $75, not including tip.  This would never happen at the 16th street location - Frankly, ownership should be paying more attention to their chains, particularly at an airport where opinions can be formed quickly by locals and visitors alike.
For being at the airport I have to say their food is fantastic. I am a taco freek and their beer battered shrimp tacos are the bomb! I get them everytime I go to the tthis airport.
Incredible nachos. Fresh made cups, variety of cheeses and super fresh ingredients. Seriously so good and shocking for an airport. Go get em.
Horrible service.  Overpriced food and drinks.  Overall lack of zest to everything and everyone working here
Try the guacamole - it's an experience.  Service is authentico too.  Cold beer -  all its missing is a beach!

Food was very delicious. Table side guacamole was awesome. We both got a taco dinner which was very yummy w a side salad. Filling and fairly  healthy, tasted extremely fresh. We got out in 30 min for a flight. Highly recommend and will definitely be back!!

I ate at the original barrio cafe on 16th which was very good and interesting (maybe a little overpriced) but definetly recommended.  The airport barrio cafe was like the owner lost control of the car and drove off the road that has taken them to success.  I ordered a burrito (don't remember which) but it was soggy, with what tasted like canned chicken and a ton of sour cream.  Nasty!!

Went here for breakfast this morning, to try something different. Definitely should have just kept walking. I know airport food is overpriced, but not like this and for the portions given. Ordered Chilaquiles with pork Verde sauce...with no pork. It had plenty of chips, eggs, a little cheese, little salsa, cubed potatoes, with little sauce. Spoke with the Manager and he stated that he gets this complaint a lot and that I should have said something when it came out. Only thing is, is that this dish comes out stacked , so how are we suppose to know if there is no meat before eating some to get to that point. Also, it was obvious there was still a lot left on the plate when we returned it. I noticed other complaints about meat portions as well. Wish I had of read reviews prior to coming here. Just know even if you complain you will still have to pay full price and leave hungry.

Nice staff. Awful food. The breakfast burrito was soggy and disgusting. There was none of the advertised salsa verde. They did remove the food from our bill, so I have to give the very nice waitress credit.

The Pollo Poblano burrito was fantastic!  Best chicken burrito I have had in a long time!  Service was great, our waitress was hustling all over the restaurant but she never forgot us or the tables around us.  The Guacamole was so good, who knew pomegranate was so great with avocado!
Usually I don't do airport food.  WOW, great food, atmosphere and awesome staff!  Brittany and Monica are awesome! Highly recommend you swing by the D-Gates.
Can't even get a simple tequila shot correct and brought in a timely fashion. Overpriced & service isn't all that.
I almost didn't stop in here due to the middling rating. I'm glad I did!  Delicious Michelada and chicken poblano torta, good music, atmosphere, and awesome murals.

Barrio was a serious letdown. Given the limited options in D gates I have given this place no fewer than five tries. Significantly overpriced for poor quality food is a pretty good summary. I even got sick one time within 20 minutes of eating. I wish D gates had better options, but I am guessing Barrio will be replaced in 2014.
Spend your money elsewhere. I had a chicken burrito and thankfully nothing else. The  servers were slow and rude and the water seriously tasted like it came out of an old outdoor water hose.

I just paid $24 ($27 with tip) for a bowl of soup, a diet coke, and an order of chips and salsa! The service was good. The soup was a decent portion and tasted good. The chips that came with the salsa were so hard I couldn't chew them without fear of breaking a tooth. When I ordered the chips and salsa, the waitress told me they cost $9, and if they were actually edible I would say OK. However, this was a huge waste money. I even tried soaking the chips in the soup to soften them up, but that didn't really work. I left nearly the entire bowl of chips. I walked out of there feeling totally ripped off. Soup, a soft drink, and hard as hell chips for $24! I won't eat here again. I know its an airport, but that is ridiculous.

14 minutes before the server came to the table. Got water in 21 minutes. Food was good but served cold. Most likely server issue male server brown hair man bun wandered about aimlessly. Another patron at the table next to me ordered a beer, we were laughing about the service, she finally got a beer about 20 minutes after she sat down.

This used to be my favorite breakfast spot in the swa gate area. I used to travel a lot, and would arrive early to grab breakfast. Barrio was always my go to spot. I think that will be changing. I ordered an omelette and it was quite small. The potatoes were luke warm, and the toast was hard as a rock! And the waitress didn't do a good job of filling my drink.

This was a great experience at an airport. The wife and I both had the pork tacos and they were great. The spicy ketchup as it's called was the bomb and made the tacos taste that much more better. Our server was on top of it and had our tea and soda glasses always full. If you are hungry and at this location in sky harbor airport, this is a must stop.

Love original Barrio Cafe and Barrio Queen in Scottsdale so thought airport Barrio was a blessing.  Had a bowl of posole and SMALL glass of wine for 26 (before tax and tip). Flight delayed so order the  "large" 8 oz wine. Get the ck-$22.74. For ONE average size/quality glass of wine.  OUTRAGEOUS. The staff shares that owners been spotted once in whole time since place is open. Way to rip off your loyal local customers.

So. You are trapped inside security and need a meal. I give this place three stars for trying. Their prices are high, even for airport food ($26 for enchiladas with sides?). I have dined here only twice, but would recommend sticking to the smaller and less expensive menu items. My enchiladas seemed to have had the cheese slide out if them, and the number of shrimp was shrimpy. I had tried the pork tacos before, and they were very good. The spicy mashed potatoes were also tasty. They do have outlets at their bench seating so you can charge your devices.

The only reason to go to this place is because you are held captive at the airport.  It is extremely over priced even for airport food.  The nachos are $17 and barely enough for one person to enjoy.  Taco Bell has better nachos than here.  The Arizona burrito has no flavor and served with salty seasoned fries.  The  margaritas are very overpriced, small and no flavor starting at $10.
Worst tasting (no flavor/taste) Blooding Mary ever!!!! No veggies included, only a lime and lemon, that looked like they were two weeks old!!

Got stuck a little longer than expected and landed here for dinner. Near Southwest gates D 1 - 8. A bit busy (its 5:30 pm) but I didn't have to wait for a seat. Nice. Traveling solo and the long counter facing out with a place to charge my phone was just what I needed for my hour and a half. They told me it cost $2 to sit here and believed them but yea.... I missed the joke being so tired. Decent looking menu and I opted for the Posole Verde. Pretty quick service. Pork, hominy, & tomatillo topped with cabbage, radish, cilantro, onions, and lime. There's some serious chunks of pork in this soup! A little spicy and extremely salty but I mean, it's pork soup. Duh. My only gripe really was when the waitress placed had spilled soup from the bowl into the dish and I had to rescue a soup covered spoon before I could eat. I'm sure I could've gotten a new one had I asked but I just wiped it down. Other than that, $10 well spent at an airport.

I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the chilaquiles! I order my food to go because of the limited time before my connecting flight. When at the counter the cashier asked how I wanted my eggs...I was slightly confused because I thought they were always mixed in. Needless to say I just said scrambled. The taste was amazing! The cheese was phenomenal and taste was incredible! The chilaquiles were prepared perfectly, they reminded me of the ones i enjoyed while living in TJ. I would definitely go back.  Try it.

I am a pilot with an hour to kill before show time of my next flight. I opt to sit down and relax while I get some good Mexican food. That was nice. I order the $6 Jamaica. The waiter was very confusing when he called it the Jamaica flower water. I've never heard it called that way and it sounds more like a lightly flavor infused water like rose water or something ludicrous. Nope, the waiter just didn't know how Jamaica is made so it seamed normal to him to call it water and not more like sweetened iced tea of flore de Jamaica. Now that's out of the way I get the Arizona burrito.  After a few minutes I down the Jamaica and the food comes out. It looks great  and I ask for a refill on the Jamaica.  There are no refills. The glass was a 12oz glass with 8oz of ice. That is $1.50 an ounce for Jamaica. Are these managers completely nuts? It was good but outside of Manhattan I've never ordered something so expensive.  The burrito was very flavorful but again small for $13 then piled high with frozen steak fries.  So $20.58 for a burrito and Jamaica later I'm out of here never to go back. There are many other great dining options here in sky harbor. No need to stop here unless you are not hungry and you don't care what things cost. Note to the managers. An appropriate price for these would be $1.75 for the Jamaica (or have free refills) and $9 for the burrito. Out the door with tip $12.50. I was so overcharged by your prices that I did not include a tip. I hope you pay your waiters well

I've been flying since the days that airport restaurants were generally considered a joke and you had pay for practically everything inside the terminal with cash.   Today, things have changed and it is more uncommon to get a bad meal in an airport than not.   Barrio Cafe in the B terminal at Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport is certainly better than your average airport fare (pun intended).   We had the guacamole and chips, as well as Burrito Pollo Poblano (chicken), and it was great. Service was prompt and attentive as well.

Of course my flight was delayed so I decided to sit down and have a meal at Barrio. First of all the service I received from both the manager and my server was some of the best I have had. After being seated, the manger stopped by to see if I had any questions about the menu, which I did, and he proceeded to go back to the kitchen and show me the type of chip they use for their nachos. While my daughter and I were waiting for our food, he brought her out a thinly sliced apple without me asking for anything. The nachos were different than I have ever had, and were awesome! Their pork is delicious and the sauce, yes sauce, for the nachos was super good. I wish they had a Barrio in Seattle because I will be craving these nachos!!

Do yourself a favor and DO NOT eat here! Terribly overpriced, my order was wrong, food was lukewarm, and had to ask for a glass of water 3 times - and finally received it in a dirty glass. Go somewhere else!
I wish I could say something good, but the food was lousy, overpriced and the service wasn't much better

I've been this to restaurant several times while waiting for my flight. I ordered the poblano sandwich and it was good. My server Marina was so helpful and friendly that I hope she's working next time I'm at the airport..

Came in for a quick bite to eat before my flight. Ordered the "Arizona Burrito" and some fries. Fries came out cold and there was some type of hard plastic in my 1st bite. Promptly informed waitress and instead of apologizing or explaining she grabbed the plastic, disappeared and showed up again with a "new" burrito. I told her I wasn't interested and she stated that these things happen and basically what's the big deal???!!! Are you kidding me???!!!! Never coming again!!

I really appreciate having the option of sampling some local restaurants in an airport, rather than just the standard chain places.  Barrio Cafe is a restaurant in Phoenix, and this is their representation inside the airport.    I chose this spot because the menu items were interesting, slightly more exotic than the standard cheese quesadilla or fish tacos.  My guac was fine.  I was not a fan of the really thick chips, but I did think the dried cranberries were a nice twist.  My pork tacos were excellent.  The side salad was small and pretty much just lettuce, but fresh.  The bar style seating facing out towards the gates was great for people watching, and there are outlets at about every other seat.  The service was fast and friendly.  I like that they have those call buttons so you don't have to try to flag down your server to get your bill, but the device design could use some work.

Lol @ the previous reviewer's comment, "Walk to Terminal C instead". Bahaha!  That's pretty funny although I can't state that I had the same experience. Departed a Corporate event this past Friday and in between flights we all developed the "munchies". We decided to split an order of nachos which was surprisingly enough for 4.  Perhaps I've grown a bit too used to the "fake" Mexican food in California however this place didn't come up short. I'll digress again and state that perhaps my expectations weren't all that heightened in lieu of this being "airport food".  I was quite taken aback. Haha... Maybe I'll fly back in for another meal.   Maybe....  Did I mention that my colleagues all became so inebriated on the booze served here that we all missed our flights??? Nothing better than being buzzed in an airport and having to wait standby for the next flight.  -___-

I'm giving Barrio Cafe 5 stars for our AMAZING and knowledgeable server- Alexzander! She helped us find delicious drinks, gluten free options, made us great table-side guacamole and modified our orders to make them perfect! She was the best and I am so thankful for her great service and kind personality!

Wow, I have a lay over flight and decided to have lunch. What a pleasant surprise. I'm enjoying the torta barrio, fantastic spice. A green chile that actually has flavor and spice, most delicious. My taste buds are jumping for joy. Ice cold Pacifico and spicy Mexican food, people watching....yeah for me!!!!

Came here to charge my phone and have a glass of wine before my flight. Maria, my server, was very kind. I ordered a 6 oz of Malbec, which was nice.  No fault of Maria's, but my wine glass was filthy. It looked like it had been run through the sani-wash and left to air dry. Lots of water spots and little hygienic misses.  I wouldn't come back for anything other than a drink. Sorry.
Ridiculously disappointed. Came to my favorite dining spot at the airport only to find that they don't serve breakfast burritos.  I am really!!!! You are a Mexican food restaurant!!!!!

After being asked by a fellow yelper to elaborate, here it goes.   We approached the hostess and asked for a table for 3 plus a high chair. When she jokingly said "no" I laughed and proceeded to ask for a menu to which she again replied "no"! I guess this was her attempt at humor, however after the first time, it seemed to have lost something. By the way, she never really indicated that she was joking.  So, $50, 1 ceasar salad, 1 spinach chicken whatever salad,  a kids chicken tender meal w/ browning apples, and a failed attempt at a pollo poblano burrito later we were on our way to catch our flight.   Oh, in between sitting down and paying the check, the service was sub-par to say the least and worse than the cold, soggy burrito and rubberized tenders. The waitress never picked up our menus and never once smiled.   While I understand we ate at an airport, this is unacceptable. Next time I'll be sure to read up on more yelp reviews before I waste a meal here.   They'll be hearing from me soon.

Loved the nachos, a definite must to get if you want to share. Not the ordinary nachos, much much better!  We had the grilled chicken nachos... awesome!  Victor is was a great waiter, very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu (he suggested the nachos), you'll be lucky to get him when stop in there before your flight.

Extremely slow service. We waited nearly ten minutes before I had to ask for a manager because  no one came to our table.  They were busy, but someone should have at least acknowledge us.  I will likely not come back.
Reena-an was so friendly she even plugged in my cell phone for me crawling on the floor to plug it in.  The food was very good to.  It made my 2 hour delay much easier

The best airport food I've had in years, if ever.   I knew I was in for something special when the waiter brought the bread and sauce, a sublime combination of tapenade, caponata and salsa.   Then came the menu. Decisions, decisions. Should I play it safe and order a burrito or try something different and new? I chose the latter and went with the cochinita pibil, a slow-cooked (12 hours) pork dish served with mashed potatoes, a sort of pico de gallo, marinated cucumbers, tortillas and a little au jus on the side. Fan-freakin'-tastic.   Not sure why the other Yelpers on here gave this place such short shrift. If Barrio's other locations really are that much better than here, then this is the best Mexican "chain" on earth.   Worth getting to the airport early for!
Good airport food...actually, just good food.  Had pollo poblano tacos with chorizo. Very good.  A bit pricey for a quick meal before a flight but beats the other options.

The airport Barrio Cafe has the best nachos I have ever had in my life... Trust me I have had a lot of nachos.  These are foodie nachos not yellow cheese game day nachos.  Last time I was at Barrio Queen they did not have them at that location.  Nachos plus a fabulous margarita here are the start to a great trip either for business or pleasure!
Hopefully their food is better than their attitude. Don't worry your faces won't break if you smile. The real Barrio Cafe 16th and Thomas might want to give a pep talk to the hostess. Ana was sweet

This was my most disappointing airport food experience ever.  Thinking, "hey, we went to barrio cafe and it was a great meal, we can have a good meal at the airport.  great!" I went in with expectations.  And those expectations were so not met.  First off, no frozen margaritas.  They're on the menu, but they were out?  How does one run out of traditional frozen margarita?  Pretty sure you take all the usual ingredients with ice and stick it in a blender.  So 2 members of our party left.  Then we get food.  Disaster.  I order the cochinita pibil (which I had the last time I was at Barrio Cafe).  Definitely not as good.  Didn't finish it.  Hardly ate it. Husband was served overcooked, dry, microwaved chicken.  We had margaritas on the rocks.  They tasted like salt.  Just salt.  They comped the chicken (after my husband complained), but we're not going back.  There are better restaurants for us to spend our money at.
Awesome upscale Mexican food for airport! Got the az burrito. Yummy green chili pork! In D terminal right by boarding
Airport in Arizona refuses to change channel to Arizona basketball game because manager won't let them.  Instead we watch nothing at all....

The food was good but they needed more meat in it. the bloody marys are excellent, have a double. Our server Cardi, short for Bacardi, was great! She did an excellent job.  Only thing I would recommend is to have the hostess wipe the tables w a dry napkin prior to sitting folks. Really annoying to sit down on a WET table top!

Three stars is probably spot-on for an aggregate score of this place.  They are in the airport but they are an extension of one of the popular local Mexican places.   That said,  I probably would have been far happier had time allowed me to go to one of their other locations.  I could sense a much higher level of cuisine when reading their menu than what arrived at my table.   I secured a table after a wait of less than 2 minutes.  Securing a server took quite a bit longer. There was a waitress who showed up after I had been sitting there for about 5 minutes but she walked right past me and proceeded to lean against a fixture behind me.  I turned around and asked her if she was my server.   She wasn't.  She didn't approach my table, didn't ask if she could be of assistance and didn't offer to find my server.  She just leaned.  I asked her to assist me with finding my server and she offered me a seat in her section instead.  I was settled,  my bags were settled... I just wanted to be introduced to my server.  With much reluctance, she finally pointed her out.  Thanks.   When my server was table-side,  I told her I can't eat jalapeños.  No problem - we can prepare almost anything you want without them.  I selected an enchiladas dish and asked if it could be prepared without jalapeños - she said the dish doesn't have jalapeños.  It arrived with something on  the side that looked a whole lot like it contained jalapeños.  Her answer: it's on the side,  you should be fine.  Should, huh?   I had the enchiladas with shrimp.  There were six small cheese enchiladas with a beautiful sauce and four decent size shrimp perched on top.  The dish was beautiful.  Sadly,  it arrived barely luke warm and the waitress vanished.     I could tell that this would have been a killer dish in one of their real restaurants  but it was flat here.  The sauce was creamy, cheesy and just slightly salty with that great mouth-filling taste that you get when you bring goat cheese to the party.  I wished I had a few tortilla chips to scrape up the remainder after I finished the enchiladas but chips don't come with the meal at this location.  The shrimp were cooked just about perfectly but lacked a scampi flavor as the menu had promised.  The tortillas were slightly hard around the edges... not sure if they were stale but it seemed likely.  I really, really wish that I had the opportunity to try their food in one of their real restaurants.  I don't know that I will be back in Phoenix anytime soon but getting to one of their real locations will be my first dining priority and I will do so with an open mind.  Unfortunately, and the other Yelp reviews bear this out, the only thing this location is doing is besmirching their good name among travelers.

Good food. Approach a little rough when walking in with a Starbucks. Come on folks this is an airport. We had a big group. They finally warmed up. At the end ok. But need to to work on that first greeting

Well.....I've been excited to fly out of the D gates because of Barrio. Unfortunately, the last 5 times I've been here, I can't get a Bloody Maria because they're out if tomato juice or the 'mix' Very disappointing, but the chilaquilles are always awesome..  Today I got my cocktail, but the service is very slow. I understand it's 3 days before NYE, but the terminal is almost empty and so is the restaurant.  Took 10mins to get a waitress so I could order, then I waited 10 to get the only thing I ordered...my cocktail.  Ehhh....

I have visited Barrio Cafe yet again as I had time while flying from D gates at terminal 4. The service was much better this visit. Although Ramiro didn't tell me his name, it's on my receipt. He was knowledgeable regarding gluten limitations and made safe suggestions. The food came out quickly. It was okay, the marinated pork was good. Unfortunately the tortillas were soaking in the juice which made for a nasty soggy mess. Ramiro brought a fresh side of tortillas at no additional charge. That was the saving grace.

Quite possibly one of the worst meals I've ever had at an airport. Overpriced menu, stale chips, nearly inedible corn tortillas. The only saving grace of the Barrio Cafe is that it serves alcohol so you can forget how bad your meal tasted.

You can tell the bartenders have no training. Really awful and you're throwing your money away because the drinks aren't cheap either. Just watching them you can see they don't know how to pour, their counts are way off, they don't know the recipes, and can't shake a cockltail correctly. I watched them pour more Grand Marnier than tequila into the tin and then squirt about 3 times more cheap sweet and sour juice into the tin. Her shake was pethetic. She gave it one up and then one more. She looked scared like she was holding a soda that may have been shaken around. Being a Mexican restaurant and the margarita being the most popular cocktail in the world you'd think they would have it down, especially for $13 each! Food is very average! For the money they charge and the quality of service you're better off going to a different terminal and eating anywhere else I promise you. If the food was average and the service was at all passable I would give this a 3 star but they really go out of their way for piss poor all around. I won't be back.

This is a great airport eatery and bar. I came here once before and had an awesome Bloody Mary. This morning my husband and I had breakfast burrito and breakfast sandwich.  Both were substantial (particularly the burrito which was bursting with chile verde) and delicious! Servers were very nice too.

You've got to expect prices at any sit down restaurant in any airport to be higher than if you were in a similar restaurant off-airport.  So I didn't flinch at the $14 price for a chicken burrito, because I knew I'd be paying over $5 for a processed burger at a fast food place (bleh!).  Instead, my burrito was chunk full of chicken, avocado and spices and was served with spicy fries.  Tasted quite good!  I sat in the lounge area on a sofa with a small table and was able to kick off my shoes and work from my iPad as I enjoyed my meal.  My server, Shauna was excellent and so friendly.  Would call me by name every time she passed by to make sure I was taken care of.  A great place to relax and enjoy a meal or drink away from the fast food crowds before taking flight!

Five star service from Rabecca thanks !  Breakfast burrito with two eggs and salsa. Top this off with a great Pinot noir wow that's a meal.  This airport really knows how to pamper it's guests.  Service in this restaurant is fast and friendly. Management is nice as well. This is a quality spot.

Pricey and the food taste old. Had the fish tacos at 11am they were fries in oil that should have been replaced fries were also so sad the place is cute service ok but the food can use both flavor and freshening up. I would not visit again.

Hubby and I had dinner here during unexpected flight delay and was seated immediately. Started with house margaritas on the rocks - arrive in small glass but was decent. Hubby got the Arizona burrito and I the shrimp tacos both with side salads. Fresh avocado slices topped the tacos even though not mentioned on menu - which made them perfect. Only complaint was each taco only came with 1 shrimp and chips/salsa were not included on table with our meal as we would see at other similar restaurants (maybe not custom @ airport setting?). Hubby described pork as a stewed pork with good flavor in large flour tortilla. Service was super quick, friendly and food surprisingly yummy. Would eat here again.

Currently waiting in line, so I can't rate the food. And I don't really care about the price (it's an airport, that's expected). But a 25-minute wait (and still counting...) for a take-out order of tacos and a torta is completely unacceptable, especially in a virtually empty airport with the tables in the restaurant area only half full.  They're somewhat new. Hopefully the next time we're here, these serious problems will be resolved. And if it's not, hopefully they'll be replaced by the next time after that. They need to fail if they can't figure this out.  *Update*: After a 30-minute wait, I decided to run to the plane (which was otherwise boarded and ready to go). After I asked for my money back, the employee at the register did not respond to me at all, then went to the kitchen window gave me one of the two to-go boxes and said it would only be a little while longer. I couldn't wait, so I figured we'd just split the one meal. Of course, it wasn't even our order. So in addition to my awful experience, that means someone else who was waiting also did not get their order (because I got it). And the torta we did get was not very good.   Ultimately, I share some blame in this. I read these other one-star Yelp reviews and still went there anyway. That was a huge mistake. This place is a disaster.

Servicing fries with burritos. Wtf No salsa with it.  Chose of salad or fries, really and this is supposed to be Mexican food  Street tacos were ok, salad dressing would make salad swim Server ( Tami) was good though very pleasant

Pretty good Mexican food in the Phoenix airport.  Hubby ordered a green chile burrito.  It had great flavor and full of pork.  The fries that came with it were a little soggy.  I had the steak tacos.  Very good!  The salad that came with it was fresh and the tacos themselves had great flavor.  I didn't care too much for the salsa, but I usually don't but salsa on my steak tacos anyway, so no loss there.  I ordered a classic margarita.  I wasn't a fan, but hubby liked it.  I REALLY liked the chips and quac.  I couldn't stop eating them, in fact I took my remaining chips to go to eat them as a snack later.  We don't get to Phoenix very often, but if we do, we would definitely come back.  Cheers!

Five stars for fresh, authentic Mexican street food, in a damn airport for crying out loud! My husband's pork burrito was tender, fresh and bursting with flavor. I ordered a shrimp quesadilla, and out came four small flat tortillas each topped with a single juicy jumbo shrimp, then covered in melted cheeses and super fresh pico de gallo. Everything was on point - the texture and home-made quality of the tortillas and chips; the slow roasted and marinated pork; the freshness of all ingredients, run out of the kitchen as soon as they were prepared. This place is better than any of the 5 mexican places in my small SoCal town. And it's in an airport. In Arizona. HUH? A bit pricey for what it is, and the wine by the glass is $10 a pop, but again, you're in an airport. If you want to eat well, it's going to cost you.

Bartender stressed the authenticity of how traditional the food is here but yet they will NOT serve a customer chips and salsa. Claims there wasn't a button for it (what ever that means) and it wasn't worth losing his job for it. If you order the $10.95 tableside guacamole you can have chips. They do HAVE chips and they DO have salsa but it's not available to customers. They offer $25 meals but no chips and salsa. What a sham.

This restaurant replaced the Wendy's that was once here, and is currently the only option for food in the D-terminal. I ordered take out once, service was terrible, and I'm never coming back.  I give it a try, so I order the Torta del Barrio to go, with fries. It's a vegetarian option for $13, including cheese stuffed peppers among other vegetables. One gentleman was in front of me, so I wait after my order.  Three people order after me within 15 minutes, each ordering items on the menu of similar preparation (one even got the same dish). They were ALL SERVED BEFORE ME! I ended up waiting for 35 minutes for a meal that wasn't even that good. The fries were soggy and bland, and the bread for the torta tasted stale. No way that cost $13, I could've made that for under $5.  The restaurant didn't look that much better. The place was packed, and they pumped out a couple dishes every 10 minutes. The majority of tables were not served the entire time I was there, and they definitely ordered before I arrived.  When you're trying to fly out, you want a quick bite to eat. The 35 minutes wait was inexcusable, especially since all those customers were served until I was dead last. The most I got out of the cashier was "Sorry, I tried." If you're going to serve food at the airport, that kind of service won't cut it.  I've never said this before, but I'd have preferred fast food at the time.

Literally had to wait 17 minutes to have a draft sam Adams poured.by the time it got to me I had to chug it so I wouldn't miss my flight. Server apologized after the fact saying they had to change the keg. I would have like to have had the option at first to switch my choice so that I could have enjoyed my beverage.

If you have time, this the place to eat & drink in the airport.  Great margaritas, the cochinita (pork) was pretty tasty, the pork fat sauce was awesome.  I saw others eating shrimp and stuffed jalapeños also look great!

Ok first things first...airport restaurant...it's all relative isn't it?  For an airport Mexican restaurant this is pretty good albeit expensive. I think the ratings are low because everyone feels so overcharged they leave feeling ripped off despite some decent to good food.

Probably better go sit down and wait for your flight. Although I cannot comment on the food, the "Cadilac Margarita" has to be one of the worst I've ever had! I'm not even sure how it's possible to screw up good tequila this bad. More sour/bitter than anything I've ever put in my mouth. I'll be puckered for weeks........ See the pictures: Security to the rescue, this is ridiculous. These guys have offered to pay for what they had but the manager is arguing over a few bucks and called security. Stay away, this place is a catastrophe!

Chiliquilies breakfast came with strips of tortilla but tasted like chips. No flavor. And barley warm.  Hardly any meat at all. Potatoes tasted like they came out of a cheap TV dinner.  Overpriced.  Coffee was ok. Came hot.

I was so excited to come here again because last time I was waiting for a flight the food and service was awesome.   Not this time.   First off, the hostess said pick a seat and stops me as I find a table and shoves the menus In my hand. I sat down for 15 minutes and no one came to serve us. The restaurant wasn't busy at all otherwise I would've understood a little bit. There was a lot of servers walking around and chatting. Two were arguing about who swept the restaurant last... um you're not going to have any floors to sweep if no customers come because the lack of service. A table gets sat after us and they got greeted within minutes.   We got up and left. No one said anything. We clearly were ready to spend money on food and alcohol but nothing.   This will be the last time I come to this place. I made my way over to Zinc and was greeted and served within a minute. Glad I found a place who will take my money.

Worst. I just spent $15 on shrimp tacos. You know, three shrimp tacos... that only had one shrimp on each taco. So, basically, I spent $15 for 3 pint sized, tiny, deep fried shrimp and the smallest excuse for a side salad I've ever seen. I've heard so many good things about Barrio and I am so disappointed. What a waste of money. No thanks. I want my money back so I can actually eat since I'm still hungry after that joke. Do not waste your money here.

Early for my flight, thought I would grab a beer and get something to eat ...  Now I am going to have to run to catch my flight!  So SLOW.  And they do not have blue moon on draft!  Won't stop here EVER again.  Wait staff is Terrible - no tip from me.

OMG... Just ordered the shrimp tacos and there were three tacos with one piece of shrimp PER TACO!!!  DO NOT GO HERE.  There are many great places to eat in the Sky Harbor Airport.  DO NOT EAT HERE.  Prices are even expensive for airport food.  STAY AWAY!!!
Used the To go menu; chose a really fresh tasty salad. Quick and delicious. So much better than a greasy burger at the airport.
Best airport food ever.  Eclectic Mexican in a nice environment--given it's an airport.  Highly recommmended!

If you are in Phoenix for a layover on Southwest this is the spot. For airport dining this place is well above on food quality and quick attentive service. It's great for people watching and although much of the food is stylized versions of Mexican food, including a lot of quick prep, reheat and serve kind of food, it's actually pretty tasty. I've had the shrimp tacos and they are pretty tasty, a bit over battered but good just the same. The fish taco plate is actually pretty decent size portion (4 tacos) for the money. Considering you are trapped for food choices the prices aren't too out of whack. The only major downside, and it is out of their control, is the volume of a/c being pumped into the terminal creates cold/windy spots in the dining room.

Beyond exceptional for airport food. We ordered two salads and they were fresh and the chicken was great. I would also like to thank our server, Marina for making sure I got my purse back to me that I left at the table. We were about to leave for Portland and I heard my name come on over the intercom. She didn't have to react as quickly as she did, but she did. I appreciate it. We also had quite a bit of cash we were carrying. Thank goodness for Marina! Give that girl a raise:-) We need more honest people like that in the world.

It's so very very rare, but this airport bar/restaurant actually has decent food and good service.  The menu is limited of course but I have never ordered anything I didn't like.   It is pricey compared to most of the other food options in the terminal. However! Did you know that all the restaurants in most US airports are all owned by the same company, it allows it to fix the market and keep all the prices high once you pass through TSA.  An absolute crime in my opinion.  This place also has a nice grab and go menu if you're in a rush.  Safe travels!!

I got food poisoning on Monday 2/8/16-ate the chorizo for breakfast at the airport Barrio in D section Got on flight from PHX to Ft Lauderdale. Within an hour an half had severe stomach pain and diarrhea. Arrived 4 hours later-got rental car and was gut wrenching vomiting out the car window. Food couldn't go thru intestines Recovered by Weds but food poisoning is terrible --a double wammy   I had loved Barrio for close to 20 years at all locations but will now stay away

I wouldn't come to this restaurant unless you simply have no choice. The wait to get in was expected on a busy travel day. However what was unexpected was the lack of friendly service. I could have dealt with that. But once our drinks finally arrived there was a bug in the ice. After asking for a new cup we where informed that it's Knatt season????? Who cares just bring me a different cup. If anyone is interested they do offer just plain chips and Sala but heads up ITS $9.00 and there are no refills on the chips or the salsa the bowl is tiny not enough for one person to snack on. Only bright spot here was the Guacamole was freshly made. Which it better be for $13.00.
I am going to try and have all of my connections through sky harbor so I can enjoy Barrio cafe. The French toast is to die for!
Eating at barrio is part of my southwest airlines airport ritual. I love their downtown location the most. I also like barrio queen in Scottsdale.

Smooth usher into the restaurant. Had a burrito minus the goat cheese it came with. Was still an oily mess. Bland. Tortilla rubbery. I could say that was the worst burrito I've had if only someone convinced me it was a burrito. Other than the claim on the menu I have no other proof. Service by loud, tough Asian lady and snot-nosed kid was horrendous. The latter slammed the food down and left without giving one of us silverware. Had to walk down one of the waiters. We asked loud Asian lady for salsa. And waited. Had to walk her down as well.  Bad service at an airport restaurant is okay. But IF you want Mexican food PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE.
Stopped in for a quick breakfast bite and a drink.  The bartender was friendly but a little brash.  No worries, I didn't plan on staying there too long anyway.

Stopped here with time to kill before my flight. Wasn't really that hungry but my sister and I decided to split the nachos. We got half beef and half chicken.   The food arrived in a surprisingly quick fashion and once I took my first bite I was in heaven.   My only issue was we asked the waiter for no mushrooms and it came with mushrooms. When we mentioned it he made a comment only four chips or so had the mushrooms. Are you serious? I would leave only 4 stars because of him as he was not friendly and was extremely slow on drink service. Waters and diet cokes...but the food redeemed him.  Back to the nachos. The chips were thick and delicious. The odd combination of spinach and bleu cheese added made an incredible addition to the nachos. Underneath the chips was a hidden liquidy sweet cheese we couldn't figure out what it was but didn't care it was SO good.   As mentioned before, I wasn't that hungry to begin with but once my sister stopped eating, I finished the whole plate. I would love to try and recreate these nachos but that seems near impossible.

We had just an hour-ish for a layover, so we stopped here for a quick dinner. Definitely very happy with our decision! Our waitress was pretty awesome. She was older and when she approached our table, she mentioned that they have $4 tequila shots. She didn't really offer the shots, as much as she told us about the shots in a way that we felt like it was a demand. Being challenged, and essentially called a wimp, we ordered the shots. My husband and I NEVER order shots when it is just us.. but hey, way to take our vacation to the next level, lady! We also ordered a couple beers (heck yes to Golden Road brews!) and the Barrio Nachos. These nachos were really really good. Beef with sauteed mushrooms, garlic, onions, jalapenos, spinach, cream, chorizo and bleu cheese and "fresh Mexican farm cheese". They also came slightly "deconstructed" so it wasn't just a messy mash of flavors. The rest of the menu looked pretty interesting as well.. not your typical Mexican food and certainly not your typical airport food. The nachos were $15, but large and enough for 2 to have as a meal. Would definitely stop here again!

Today I decided that I'm going to eat at a place I've never been. I'm at the D terminal so checked this place out. Was greeted and seated right away. I just ordered water for my drink and that came pretty fast too.   Ordered their "famous" pork tacos with seasoned fries. The food came in literally minutes so that's great. Looked good and it smelled good. The fries came with spicy ketchup which was good but the fries were not crunchy on the outside. Seems like they have been waiting for me in the kitchen under the hot light. Seasoned? Deff not! I had to add salt. The "famous" pork? Not sure how bec there's no flavor on it. I had to add salt and I don't normally add salt to my food. It's just that there's no seasoning. I couldn't taste the flavors described on their menu. The corn tortillas tasted like they just took them out of the package. They didn't taste like they were even heated. The salsa was bland and by the way for a Mexican restaurant, they don't have rice and beans.   For $15, deff not coming back. The service is good and fast, hence the two stars but I'm not spending $15 on tacos that don't have flavor.
Best chicken enchiladas I have ever have.  Service ranges from outstanding to horrible depending on your server. If the service was consistent I'd give the enchiladas 5 stars.
Carne Asada was terrible small portion lots of fries. No flavor. I have eaten here twice both meals terrible.

Pros:  They have TVs. Cons:  All they're good for is the TVs. Seriously, if a kool-aid stand set up next to them and had TVs, I'd prefer to go there (especially if they sold vodka).  I ordered the fish tacos.  I think (and I'm not exaggerating) there was 1 oz. of fish in THREE tacos.  One was just batter.  And waaaaay over seasoned...think seasoned salt and Old Bay together.  Service?  Praytell, what's that?  I had to wave down my server after she was texting and later chatting with other servers.  Bottom line:  If you have time go to C gate (short walk) and you'll find TVs and better service.

It beats the average Airport food option but Sky Harbor is not average, not any more. There are so many great local food options here and I wouldn't say that Barrio is the best of them by far. They had some beer of draft so that was cool, just mexican beer though which isn't very exciting.   I ordered the Pork something Burrito which said it was Enchilada Style, with a side of Barrio Fries (only because my husband wanted fries). It's kind of weird to serve Seasoned Fries with a Burrito but whatever. The Burrito was just Pork, nothing else, and it hadn't even been filled all the way so there were gaps where filling should be and it was very thin for a Burrito. The Pork was fine, didn't see or taste the Green Chilies mentioned in the description and the Enchilada Style consisted of a teaspoon of grated Cheese pathetically sprinkled on top. The Tortilla was so soggy and not in a saucy Enchilada sort of way, in a watery wet nasty kind of way.   I ordered it to go so I couldn't really say anything but next time I'm going somewhere else. There are tons of other really great options in this airport!
The breakfast burritos here are much better then the other place. I really liked the salsa they give you and the price was a little better.

I was hungry as I didn't eat breakfast before boarding my plane and Phoenix is where my connecting flight is. I ordered from the take out line. I tried ordering from the menu on the wall, but was told they still serving only breakfast and the cashier lady pointed me to the breakfast menu. So many options to choose from or the lack thereof... I ordered the Arizona Burrito which came with eggs. The burrito had cheese meat and potatoes on it. The meat saved the burrito from being too land. If I'm going to pay $13 for a burrito, it should've been a bit more tastier than this. I can get a much bigger burrito at a taqueria anywhere in San Francisco for about half that price.

Best airport food I've ever had hands down... uhhh hello!?! You're in an airport and buying alcohol did you expect it being cheap?!?! For an airport place it has great food, I had the chicken poblano burrito wife had pork tacos... they we're both outstanding! Yes a bit expensive but again you're in an airport! As far as it replacing Wendy's???? Are ya kidding me?!?! Hell yes! Go to sleep!!!

I understand this is the PHX Airport location, but it was NOT impressive.  I had the Taco Pescado  (fish taco) and it was very good.   My wife had the Burrito, and it had pieces of PAPER inside! She ate about 1/3 of it before seeing the paper. Her 1st glass of water had a hair in it!!!  No reflection on the waiter because he handled the situation perfectly.  He knows how to treat a dissatisfied customer.  Thanks for your good service and understanding.     The kitchen staff obviously needs to clean up!

This is an okay place near the D Gates in Terminal 4. I had a five hour layover at PHX so I thought I'd try it since a friend recommended it.   I had flan and a strawberry frozen margarita. Both were fairly average tasting and a bit expensive ($12 each).  The booth was ripped in multiple spots and I waited 30 minutes after sitting down before someone asked me if I had been helped. Luckily I wasn't in a rush.    A plus, if you sit along the booth there are outlets so you can charge your phone.

Nothing like the original, which I love.  I ordered the poblano chicken burrito.  I got a soggy burrito loaded with dry chicken, go figure. Anyway it's sounded great spicy chicken with grilled pablano, onions,  etc... I asked the waitress she went to the kitchen, only to come back and say it doesn't come with peppers or onions.  My response,  menu says it does. Well we're out of peppers, I can give you 10% off is that ok. No,  I didn't order a pile of chicken I'm a soggy burrito.  5 minutes late she comes back with a side of grilled onion,  peppers,  whatever else was supposed to be in the burrito.  It helps but I'm annoyed and the meat is cold at this point.  Whatever,  I have a flight to catch,  I just paid my tab (no discount), I'm done and never coming back.

Let's start this way. I could not decide between pork or beef tacos. I asked the server he said that the chef was known for her pork treatment. Chef ?? pork treatment?? These are words I would have never expected to hear at an airport restaurant. Way cool. And the food itself delicious again very unexpected at an airport. This is not the least expensive place here but well worth it. You are about to be crammed on to a SWA plane at least enjoy this one luxury.

Went there for breakfast.  Didn't want to shuffle around in a line and wander through crowds to find somewhere to sit.  Other reviews say service was bad, ours was fine.  Food was good.  It's an airport restaurant which means expensive but overall had a fine experience.
Service is slow, and the Bloody Mary that I love to have before a flight was way disappointing.

What can you say other than it's an airport restaurant? Everything is overpriced & not too high on quality but the drinks are good & it gives you something to do while you wait for boarding. At least the server was decent.

The most disgusting and unsanitary worker I have ever seen! Blew her nose  multiple times behind the bar, literally dug her finger in her ears, coughed/hacked and used her hand as a snot rag. Took out the trash, reached inside the trash and never washed her hands. Here's the kicker... she reaches INSIDE the water pitcher pour spout with her nose-wiping, ear-drilling , trash picking hands... who does that?   Health department would have a field day. Yuck, left after telling the managers... who, interestingly enough , were there to watch the whole thing without stopping her.
Sure, it's a little pricey - it's at the airport. But what a great hangout, Tammy delivered excellent service, food was delicious, beer was cold!

Bland and boring.  Whats with the fries?! No body in the world wants mexican food with fries.  A bad representation of Phoenix in an impressionable location.  Besides the sub average flavor the tradion of bad attitudes and slowness from the employees carries on from the 16th st location to the airport.  Never again Barrio. Dont believe the hype.

The Chiles en Nogada was phenomenal! I've never reviewed an airport restaurant before because I never thought they were anything special. Barrio Cafe is worth it.  I got the Chiles en Nogada, which is a "roasted poblano pepper filled with chicken, dried fruits, apples and pears all in a delicate almond cream reduction." I was floored with how good it was. Pricey at $26, but wow. Amazing taste, texture, and presentation.  My girlfriend got the Tacos de Pollo Poblano, which include "grilled spiced chicken breast, roasted poblano peppers, caramelized garlic and onion, tomatillo cream reduction, goat cheese, pine nuts, and crema Mexicana." Delicious and filling at $14.  To top it off, our server Carma was attentive to us and every table around us. She made the hectic dinner rush look like no big deal. A true professional. We will definitely be back for more.

Save your time and frustration! 35 minutes to get a cup of coffee and French toast. Aloof attitudes, slow service, cold food... Yikes!!! What a bad experience... again.. I won't make this mistake a third time and I fly 40x/yr.

I've been here 4 times only because of It's convenience to my terminal. Of these times, I can honestly say that 3 out of 4 waitresses were extremely grumpy and not nice. I have been let down by the food each time. I think the first time I ordered a salad and noted how little protein was given, the second time I had nachos and they put blue cheese on them which tasted horrible, the third time a different salad which I was equally as disappointed about, and this last time I ordered shrimp tacos. They put 1 shrimp in each taco. Yes, you read that correct  : 1 shrimp for a total of 3 shrimp for a total of $17.00 plate. I've had enough of this place and heaven forbid I have to fly out of this terminal again. I'm sure I will, but I'll walk over to a different terminal to eat.

While I do love Barrio Cafe, the airport location has fairly poor service. It took forever to get a waitress to my table, and then I had to ask three times and several people for water with my meal. I will say I ordered the Mexican prepared soup and it was fabulous. I believe the food is at least four stars, but the pricing is quite high and service inconsistent at best. They need to get this right as the regular restaurant locations, at least the food, is five stars.

I was desperate for food during my layover a the Phoenix airport and fell upon Barrio Cafe.  Not many vegan or vegetarian options.  I ended up ordering some kind of veggie sandwich, which was okay.  It came with this delicious yellow sauce that made the sandwich edible. I was told that it was tomatillo sauce- yea, I'm pretty sure that was inaccurate.    What was disappointing about this place was how unwilling they were to accommodate your dietary needs.  No substituions or changes... you order what's on the menu. That's it.  And no salsa or chips to start-- I was told they didn't even have traditional salsa in stock... Rather rude staff too.  And, of course, prices are quite inflated to properly exploit your hunger during your airport visit.  I encourage you to bring some snacks before going to this airport.

Came here on a layover and noticed that the restaurant next door got 4 stars. Well, we have not  had mexican food for a while and decided to try it.  Food came out fast but cold. Service non existent after the food came out. Food was not bad altho.

For an airport resto, this place rocks! On my recent layover I had an excellent breakfast. The thick-cut bacon was wonderful, my eggs were cooked to perfection and the potatoes had great flavor and crunch. They have French press coffee, which is pretty cool given the location of this place. Add a touch of top-notch service and an ice-cold beer, and this was the breakfast of champions.

Just had weirdest experience.  Wanted to get beer b4 flight.  Somebody had roll-on at bar between two seats.  Was told couldn't stand at bar in space occupied by somebody's roll-on.  Can not stand at bar. Must have seat.  Currently enjoying IPA at LGO. Standing!

Come into Phoenix often for our layovers and travel frequently thoughout the country, so I'm absolutely familiar with over priced mediocre airport food. This place was a delight on my palate, the michelada mix was authentic and full of flavor, they had to have used ground red dehydrated chile in the mix and on the rim; totally worth having two! My wife ordered the green pozole woth a tomatillo base, I thought it was going to be tangy and water (true to airport style food) and I was absolutely wrong, the caldo (soup) was delicious, hearty and absolutely full of flavor; the prok was tender and garnishes were the cherry on top. I had the green chile pork burrito which was also really good, they top off the burrito woth extra green sauce which made it even better. Wasn't too spicy which is normally a downfall for me but becauae the burrito and chile verde weren't lacking on flavor there was jo need for extra salsa. For an airport restaurant this was and will be one of my top picks! I understand people complaining about price, but get over it, you're in an airport and everything you buy past those tsa lines are going to be way over priced, so sit back and enjoy your overpriced beer and fairly priced airport meal. Our server was also attentive, friendly and brought us everything we needed before we even asked. :) happy airport hopping people

The airport doesn't leave many eating options and this was what looked like the best of the bunch.  They have a typical type of choose your container then meat then toppings. I had the pork in a bowl with rice and beans, the helping was pretty ample for the moderately high prices.  There weren't many seats but we squoze in a small table that opened up!   I hate airport eating but this was pretty satisfying

Ridiculous excuse of a restaurant and being from AZ...it's embarrassing. Taking gouging to a new level. We asked our server for chips & salsa while we waited, she said "sure, but I have to tell you it's a little bag with just a few chips and a small cup of salsa for $9.00. Really? The service was average, food - exceptionally average and the prices...? Def not going back.

Nice surprise, rarely do you ever find good Mexican food in a airport. (Actually I have never) until now  . This is a do over. Wish this was a restraint back In albuquerque !! Would recommend ! The Arizona burrito was great !

It was a Sunday AM at ~6:30 AM. Place was empty. Me = only customer. Only positive was the service....and I question that because the server had to see the lack of quality on the plate that was set before me...and still left it. So here is what my $20  bought me (includes tax and tip)...  Ordered Omelette Mexicali and a soda.. I do not know what was specifically wrong with the eggs, but they were not right. I think the menu states three eggs...yeha right...unless they meant quail eggs. Kind a watery on top of it.  A "little" toss of cheese on top.  The pico on the plate was old. Seriously? I appeared to be the first customer of the day and they give me this old stuff? Yuk!  The potatoes were disgusting. Ate two bites.  They were old, wrinkly and soggy. They had a funny taste to them that I could not place. I almost had to use the air-sick bag on the plane when I was thinking "Why did I eat those?". Oh..the toast was good with the packaged butter and jelly.  They are NOT getting any more of my money...ever. I am OK paying airport process for food, but if it is disgusting like this then shame on them!!!   Please go out of business so another place can have a shot at that spot.

Not bad at all, especially for overpriced airport food!  Margaritas are good and strong, perfect for a delayed flight. Barrio is a very pleasant surprise for the airport where I am used to eating crappy $10 sandwiches. Coffee is french pressed and very tasty, even for coffee snobs.

Ordered the quesadilla that described shrimp cheese etc. Came presented as a flat open faced taco- picked it up to take a bite and it was all crunchy! The shrimp was cooked with a full shell burried in the quesadilla - OMG had to pick out each shrimp to eat separate from the "quesadilla". Just an awful experience.
