The flavor was good and good had been a good dish - epic fail on execution. PS- Waitress came by to ask how everything was - I shared and was told " I don't know - I just work here" "That's just how they make it"....F for customer service too

The food was okay, not bad and not great! The prices are astronomically high even for a restaurant at an airport, $15 for 3 mini tacos and $6 for an 8 oz. horchata (rice water) drink. The cup was filled with approximately 80% ice. While this would simply cause me to never visit the restaurant again for providing little value in the equation, I write this review to warn others of a more egregious problem. When I asked the waiter for a refill, he asked if I wanted to purchase another drink and I said no, I simply want more as the cup was mostly ice and for $6, I expected more. He argued that he did not set the amounts nor was he responsible for establishing the price.   Perhaps, my expectations of adequate service in this day and age are not realistic but to have a business operate in this way with their customers seems right down nasty! While the general discourse in our society sinks deeper in the gutter, one would expect for a business that relies on customers frequenting their establishment, the common sense approach would call for a decent treatment even if there's a disagreement on the value one receives. While I know competition is limited at an airport and I know there are many out there like myself, I will never shadow their doorway and surmise many that have a similar experience will rather opt to starve.
The service and food are great. Pollo poblano! So delicious along with the organic margarita. Our server was very knowledgeable of the recipes. Very good!

Phoenix Sky Harbor has it all over other airports- delicious food!  Was served a tasty salad of fresh ingredients- spinach, roasted tomatoes, crumbly blue cheese, apples, nuts and spiced chicken breast in a lovely vinaigrette.  The draft Negro Modelo was cold and perfect with the salad.  Marina's service was delightful!   This experience was the exact opposite of the crap we were served in Orlando yesterday.
I should have known better, but just avoid. Expensive for very below average, tasteless and sloppy food and somehow horrible margaritas.

Everytime I stop at the PHX airport I make it a point to stop at the Barrio Cafe. They have exceptional margaritas especially there "Lowrider" margarita. There food is also really good especially for airport food.

Best Restaurant in the entire airport!  I had the chicken tacos with verde cream sauce.....fantastic.  Friendly people and perfect SW cuisine!  Pricey but it's the best kept secret at the Sky Harbor airport in Phoenix!!!!!!!!!!!  Many of my friends always come to the Barrio Cafe!

Kevin, the bartender should probably find work that does not involve contact with other humans. What a joke...seriously can not understand how he would be hired...I blame Managment for that one. Food was pretty good. The Suizas was delicious and my waitress was very attentive for how packed it was for the 4th travel Rush. Sit away from the bar and you should be fine. Would have been 4 stars if he wasn't involved. Best bet may be for you to pack a lunch.
Best Airport food I have ever tasted.  Table side guacamole a must have!

Airport food can be sometimes iffy at best, but we decided to eat at Barrio Cafe because it was one of two restaurants near our gate.   The decor is not bad considering we're in an airport, and the volume level is louder than most areas due to everybody being compacted in a small area and drinking beers.   Our server was Lori. I wasn't too impressed with her. She was all business and it was clear that she was only there to take our order and fill our drinks. The restaurant was busy as it was lunch time, but it doesn't take much to smile and pause an extra second or two.   I ordered the chicken quesadillas. I was expecting a quesadilla in the traditional sense of two tortillas with cheese melted in between. What I got was more of a street taco with melted cheese and chicken on top. 4 small tortillas with 4 small pieces of chicken. NOT worth the $16.50 we were charged. The food definitely was flavorful but unfortunately the service just made the whole experience very bland.

i ended up at the bar in the barrio cafe in the phoenix airport on january 3, 2014 during the Polar Vortex.  the bar was crowded with fellow stranded travelers.  i sat at of those tall bar tables with 5  guys who were all waiting for their flights to depart or arrive. the service at the bar was extremely efficient in spite of the overwhelming number of customers. no one waited any length of time for a drink to be delivered. one of our fellow lost sheep ordered the Nachos Barrio. everyone stared at it as it looked like an incredible mess, and yes, it was a mess. there was blue cheese, some kind of meat that should not be on a nachos, for $17.00. do not order the Nachos Barrio.

Just had lunch there. I arrived around 9:30 wasn't to impressed with the breakfast menu. I had a great server Anna. I had a drink called Chata which was delicious but pricy for a small glass. I had to wait till 10 to order off the lunch menu. I ordered the tacos de Camaron. I was very disappointed do not recommend them at all. Very small one shrimp on each taco, no flavor. I had to dump Tapatio and it still tasted like I was just eating corn tortilla with fried batter. Anna did offer me something else but I didn't have time to wait for them to make something new. I had to catch my plane. The star is for Anna

The food is good as always. Checked in and seated quickly. Wait staff looks unhappy and by the end of the meal seem to be rushing people to leave so the next group can be seated. Love the food but a little dissatisfied with the service
Below average food.  Slow-to-average service.  Forget ordering anything out of the ordinary.

I had an excellent breakfast type burrito here, I was surprised how good it was.  The coffee was really weak and nutty, looked like tea but that could be the way folks like it in Phoenix.  Good service too.

Coming back from San Diego I was hungry not starved. Since the Barrio Café was near my gate I stopped in looking for something cold to drink and nothing too heavy to eat. The menu was chock full of belly stuffers and just before giving up I spied the Posole Verde Soup. It was deliciously described as: Pork, hominy. Roasted tomatillo and poblano soup topped with shredded cabbage, sliced radish, and diced onion. What a fabulous choice. The large chunks of oh so tender pork, the spices, and the wonderful broth was off the charts. I added some hot sauce and bingo it went from a solid 8 to a 10.  This was one of my best airport restaurant experiences to date. I just wish I had a thick slide of coarse bread to sop up the remaining broth!!!! Service was great at the bar. The bar stools are kind of funky as the cushions are too thick and soft you feel like one false move and you will flip off.

Nice "fancy" restaurant in phx. Great staff, excluding the hostess, great wine pours, but the barrio salad tasted like it was dragged thru the barrio streets before being plated. It sounds promising but the favors taste awful. Get something else.

The food options at this airport are not great.  But if you avoid this place, do.  The food is terrible.  They should be embarrassed serving this rubbish.  The people who work here on the other hand are great!  I feel bad they have to serve this "food".
$15 for a top shelf margarita on the rocks and the mix was so terrible I couldn't finish it.

Disappointing. Waitress took 15 minutes before I flagged them down. They took my order but no follow up and waiting another 10 minutes to get my check. I had the chicken nachos which were average. Did not like my drink the Sergio. Was way heavy on the tequila and not refreshing and light which is what I was hoping with the fruit juice and mint.

I've been to many airport restaurants through the years as a business and personal traveler. This is on the better end of those eateries. The menu is fairly diverse and everything looks delicious, not warmed up in a microwave in back.  I was seated in a lounge area I hadn't seen when I was waiting for a table. I was the only one in the room for quite a while. There were two sofas, a high top table wrapped around a post and my high top. Two TVs were off and I overheard a waiter say one was broken. I was worried I would be neglected but my waiter made sure I wasn't.  I wanted a snack so ordered the nachos with chicken and a Cadillac margarita, rocks salt. OK, it was a bit heavy for a mid-afternoon snack but I had skipped lunch.  The nachos were good but the homemade chips were quite chewy, not crunchy. I found it a bit challenging to eat. The flavors were all over with bleu cheese, goat cheese, chorizo and a creamy cheese fondue. I liked the look of the dish more than how it tasted.  The margarita was super strong.   The menu has quite a bit and it's unique Mexican food so it's on the upper end of airport food. Even though I wasn't thrilled with my meal, I liked the ideas coming together and want to try more the next time I'm in Terminal 4, D section.  The discrepancy in reviews is amusing. Airplane travel is stressful and time is limited. Of course a sit-down restaurant like this with a higher end menu is going to take time or the understaffed wait staff will neglect people. Have to take the low reviews with a grain of salt.  I saw the tall beers and was envious of those who ordered them. Next time.

Give it 3.5 stars. Service is really quick I got my food in about 5-10min. I had the Arizona burrito. It was pretty good. Filled with tender pork topped with green chili. The green chili was flavorful. I would recommend. The fish tacos looked good too.

Overpriced, even for an airport ($24 for a glass of Sonoma Cutrer Chardonnay?), inconsistent service (ice-cold fries and dirty wine glasses served up with a smile), and an "iconic" menu that probably will leave you scratching your head (Chilis en Nagoda? Cochinita Pibil? Comida Chingona? Ensalada Tata?).  Seriously, is this the kind of food you want if you only have a 30-minute stopover before getting on a 3-hour flight?  Perhaps if you're feeling lucky and adventurous, but me?  Not.
Maybe it was just me being sick, but other said the same. Their signature dish wasn't all that fantastic. Pricey, but hey, what do you expect at the airport. The Jack Daniels Sangria was tasty.

Really slow service, even the hostess avoided welcoming us into the restaurant! If you crave just something simple, forget it  sometimes some basic nachos would be great, or a chicken quesadilla maybe, but not here. How about counting 5+ servers, only 6 tables and they all walk by and say nothing!  Service is nothing short of extremely horrible.  Oh then chops and salsa, nope!!  No tipping is the only positive thing, that's only because its to be earned!

Second time eating here.  Food is very low quality for price.  Manager was extremely condescending when a question was asked.  I have truly never dealt with someone who had such a large chip on their shoulder.   I originally asked the question of the server and told her I did not want to speak to the manager.  She sent him anyway.    I would suggest that she not have her manager intervene for her as he was not a good advocate but quite rude and condescending.   I would not suggest eating here.  LaGrange next door is much better in terms of quality and taste.   I understand it's quite difficult to find quality employees.  It's too bad this establishment has had to settle for someone who is not an advocate for customer service.  Approach makes all the difference.  Acting like a jerk and making statements that are condescending does not make a difference.
If they charge $11 for a tiny glass of friggin' Cadillac they'd better make it right. Boy, this place sucks. That is why I live in LA!

The server seemed to think I was just a poor kid who wouldn't tip. So he was rude, took forever to bring my check and didn't even ask why I pushed my plate to the other side of the table with most of my food still on it. The Arizona burrito was a soggy pile of blandness.  Oh how tempted I was to prove him right on that tip.

It's always a nice surprise when you get through TSA without the humiliation of a body cavity check and find yourself with an unplanned extra half-hour before going through the routine of lining up for your Southwest Airlines flight. At least that's what spurred me on to give this cafe a try. I usually skip airport eateries since my track record with them is dismal worldwide. Take a look at my list if you don't believe me (list: http://bit.ly/2c4CL6X). This one appears quite popular as I must have tripped over at least three roller suitcases on the way to my tiny table.  Getting the server's attention was the biggest challenge since everyone looked like they were getting ready to take off. I didn't have time to have lunch at the office since I tried to squeeze in too many meetings before getting to Sky Harbor. Airport prices are a bitch but what the hell since I was expensing it anyway. I decided to order the $9.75 bowl of Posole Verde, which combined bits of pork, hominy, roasted tomatillos and poblano peppers into a nice broth and topped it with shredded cabbage, sliced radish, and diced onion (photo: http://bit.ly/2c4DwwD).  It was one of the better soups I've had, certainly at an airport terminal. I followed that with the $14 Tacos de Pescado, a trio of Tecate beer-battered fish topped with shredded cabbage and avocado slices, drizzled with a Baja aioli, and accompanied by a tiny side of baby greens (photo: http://bit.ly/2cxjFWm). They were pretty decent for bar bites but honestly not much more than that if you're expecting something close to your favorite taqueria. Anyway, I'm just glad Phoenix Sky Harbor has one decent dining option in Terminal 4.  FOOD - 3 stars...posole was good and flavorful, the fish tacos less than stellar AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...it is the airport so guard your toes against aggressive travelers who pull their roller suitcases with indifference SERVICE - 2 stars...he disappeared when I needed to get going TOTAL - 3 stars...airport eating is a dicey proposition but this one is a cut above

On a short stopover we were HUNGRY and had two choices in our terminal.  Barrio Cafe looked like they had seating available and hey, Mexican food!  We were seated and greeted and provided water right away.  Our server was friendly and attentive throughout our whole meal.   When I looked over the menu, I discovered it wasn't really your standard Mexican food and the husband was disappointed not to find beans and rice on any of the dishes.  We both ended up going with tacos,  I got the fish tacos and I think he got the chicken tacos.  All I know is they were FANTASTIC. Both came with a small green salad with a spicy vinagerette that was tangy and zesty.  The husband never gets vinegarette and he loved it. My tacos came with good sized slices of Avocado and were super tasty.  It was the perfect amount of food and my fish was battered and crunchy on the outside and flaky on the inside.  We were skeptical when we ordered, but both agree we were very happy with the choice. If you're in Sky Harbor awaiting a flight, I totally recommend Barrio Cafe.  Its not your regular Mexican Restaurant, but the tacos are delish.

A must for airport goers! Here's the story: After a friendly encounter with the TSA, then followed by an uncomfortable find of a store called "Indigenous," my stomach's attention was caught by a cafe called Barrio. My legs then followed suit as my stomach gave chase to the Mexican influenced aromas. I was greeted by friendly staff and fast service, but more importantly was the "famous guacamole."

I enjoyed what they call their "Arizona Burrito". The (smallish) burrito is filled with an amazing mix of tender pork and cheese covered lightly with flavorful sauce. I opted for the garden salad side and it was a very good accompaniment.  My wife had the skirt steak street tacos and she loved them. She grades her street tacos on a tough curve. Order coffee and it comes to the table in a large french press. We chose Barrio Cafe only because we were very hungry on a recent layover and they  had open seats. Turned out alright.  Unlike many of the reviews below we experienced prompt and polite service. *I knocked off a star because a burrito should not cost $13.50 no matter how good it is.

Service issues ! Usually come here when I travel to AZ because the Mexican food is different and well prepared. This guy Pedro is so annoying and lazy. The place got pretty busy right after we arrived for breakfast . The young lady was seating people, taking orders, cleaning tables. She called out for help in both English and Spanish. He kept putting her off and never really made himself useful. Irritating!

Ok, for an airport.  The Arizona burrito was pretty bland, but not bad.  I think there were four beers on tap, so you're lucky to get one good craft beer.  Food and beer is at an average price, which is always a shock in an airport.  My server was awesome though.    Bottom Line:  In a pinch, it's ok and won't break the wallet.

We came in expecting mediocre airport food. We were so surprised. The fish tacos are amazing. So are the french fries. It is also really nice because it is a sit down restaurant, so when you are worn out from traveling it is really nice to have someone else wait on you! :) The service is slow, but friendly. We will definitely be coming back here next time we stop through this airport.

Missed a flight at sky harbor and grabbed a Bloody Mary here while I waited. It was one of the tastiest Bloody Mary's I've had in a long time... our server was even cool enough to ask if I had any preferences with how I liked them made. May have to make grabbing a drink here a travel ritual.

1. My waitress provided great service and it weighted to the 3 stars.  2. Airport food is expensive, this is uber expensive for what you get I'm my opinion. $13 for not so great chips and ok guac.  3. The $22 dollar chicken enchiladas were pretty much bland.

This place is delicious. I only had 30 minutes to eat before I had to get in line for my Southwest flight. I decided to see if I could get a quick lunch. I ordered their house burrito. Yum! The burrito is slow cooked, tasty with just a touch of spice. Their salsa was also delicious.  Decor is pleasant, colorful and there are good seats at the bar.  I was served quickly and finished just in time to pay the check with my American Express, walk over to the gate and get on my flight.

The Michelada was pretty tasty. The torts we Rude red to share was good but not the one we ordered.  Our waitress offered to have it remade but we had to catch a flight and service was slow.  It's expensive but what do you expect from a restaurant at the airport.  .
Why do I always eat here? Food is just okay. Expensive and very slow service

High end dining in the airport? Well personally I thought the menu was a little over the top but I did think the margarita (pink Chevy with sugar), homemade guac made table side, chips and salsa were really good. A bit pricey but service and food were good.

I recently tried out Barrio Cafe while on a layover in Phoenix, Arizona and I have to say... as expected, the food and drinks were far too overpriced for what they were. I ordered just a traditional margarita on the rocks with salt and in my mind, I imagined it to arrive in a big wide rimmed margarita glass but instead it came to me in a tiny quarter size larger than a shot glass! World's smallest margarita, mostly made up of ice. I then decided to try a chicken quesadilla and found it to be the exact opposite of what a traditional quesadilla is.... it was an open faced corn tortilla more like a tostada but limp... okay I guess it was a taco?? So strange. After tasting it I then realized they made the dish with cream cheese. So strange. Needless to say, I will not be back.

I was at the airport and wanted to eat a little something before my flight.  I decided on the guacamole.  It was fantastic!  There is even a little surprise of pomegranate seeds in it.  They prepare it table side and you can tell them how much or how little of each ingredient you want.  The chips were also good as was the ice tea.  The next time I am in town I will definitely go to the regular Barrio Cafe in Scottsdale.

Just as expensive and crappy as their main location. But it was the only place in the vicinity for booze. Then got hungry and had a salad that was 12 freakin dollars for hardly anything. What a joke. LAME!!! Stay away people!

I'm an avid Yelp user, but I am not one to leave a review. This restaurant however, I felt truly deserved one. This was much more than a meal, it was an experience. From the genuine service, hundreds of different kinds of tequila, decor, feel, unique ingredients in their entrees, to their flavorful robust coffee! Every plate was served in an artistic manner with vibrant colors and different textures that had me excited to eat. We had the quesadilla de camaron borracho, chiles en nogada , and the filet mignon de mi tita and all 3 dishes were AMAZING!! You can't go wrong with any of the 3.

After a hectic morning which resulted in me missing breakfast I ended up in the Sky Harbor Airport around 1:00PM with a short one hour layover. The Barrio Cafe appeared to be the only restaurant that I could eat at and still see my gate. Needless to say, I was starving and everything sounded good. I had ordered the Arizona Burrito. It was... Well... Bland and distasteful... The meat had large chucks of hard inedible fat in it and lacked flavor. Even for airport food the Barrio Cafe is terrible. Service was mediocre the waitress was indifferent and preoccupied talking to her co-workers. I will never go here again. Even if this was the only place to eat I would rather go hungry until I land at my destination then eat at the Barrio....

We ordered tableside guacamole, quesadilla borracha, and a Cadillac margarita. The table side guacamole is not worth it at all, not only the size and the taste, and the chips are thick and bland.  Also the Cadillac margarita was eh; I've had way better Cadillac margaritas. The quesadilla borracha was the best thing, yet it was still mediocre. Find a better place to spend your layover.

My husband and i just ate breakfast and it was good. After we paid $30 for breakfast I asked the lady behind the bar if she would fill my water contigo with ice so i could add water before we boarded our flight. She said "Im not allowed". I said "really we just paid $30 for breakfast and you cant give me ice????"    Good food the WORST service made me think that I won't eat again at Barrio cafe.  So disappointing!!!

Tasty food fast service slow drink order non-existent. Prompt service button major failure prices way too high. Service slow....  Slave to airport food pathetic. Reminder to eat at home or before checking into airport. I finished my food before getting my drink the gal sitting next to me offered her water she hadn't touched... Finally got my $15 drink in a tiny cup... Ugh!

I love Phoenix airport cuisine.   Green pork breakfast burrito was awesome. My only real complaint was I asked for a poached egg and was told I had to have fried or scrambled only. $30 for breakfast for 1, I would expect more than 2 egg options.

Horrible food, terrible service. Although acclaimed to be some of the best mexican food in the region I was fully disappointed with my experience at Barrio Cafe. I ordered the table side guacamole appetizer which was brought out following the the main dish only after I mentioned not receiving it. It also wasn't prepared table-side like the menu describes & the ingredients weren't even mixed together but instead thrown in unstirred. The "iconic" Cochinita Pibil tacos turned out to be so greasy & gross I couldn't stomach more than a bite. The ONLY thing I enjoyed about this experience was the artwork by Calle 16: Mural Project. Definitely don't recommend Barrio Cafe & won't be back.

Before today, I would have given this place a solid 4, maybe even 5 star review. I've been here many times for lunch and  dinner. I've even intentionally chosen to have my layover in PHX because I love the food at this place! That all came crashing down today...Breakfast was so gross! The hostess was super friendly. Our server was warm, friendly, and speedy. The food food was terrible. My husband and I both ordered the pork verde burrito with (scrambled) eggs. The pork has a strange gamy flavor and I actually wondered if the eggs were real!?! Something was very off and totally disappointing. My kids had the pancake kids meals. They were fine. For a $60 breakfast, I felt robbed. I know they can do better. I'll be sticking to the lunch and dinner menu from now on. The carne Asada or shrimp tacos with a side salad are delicious!

Really flavorful light Mexican food. The pork tacos and pork burrito were great! A little odd to get steak fries with tacos at a Mexican place. The peach margarita was pretty good. It had a nice peach flavor with just a hint of the tequila in it. Defiantly not your traditional Mexican food but I loved that it was so light tasting before flying. Service was a little slow, but she was nice. Would try again when flying from Phoenix.

I wish I could tell you what Barrio Cafe is like, but my experience wasn't very helpful.  While traveling, I was at Sky Harbor for a layover between flights and wanted to get some lunch. Barrio Cafe was right next to my gate, so I decided to go for it even though the prices were a little high.  I was seated quickly next to an older couple, and shortly after I was settling into my seat they had an appetizer delivered. I asked them what it was, because it looked quite good, and found out it was the tecate breaded fish and shrimp. I was tempted to grab it for a meal, and thanked them for letting me know.  I perused the menu. No server came by.  I plugged in my phone at the A/C outlet next to the table. No server came by.  The couple next to me finished their meal. No server came by.  The couple requested their check and their waiter dropped it off, then turned and walked away. No server asked if I had been helped.  The couple next to me paid their check and asked "Has anyone even gotten you a drink yet?"  I checked my watch. It had been 15 minutes since I was seated, and I had 20 minutes before my flight was supposed to start boarding.   I stood up to leave. The waiter who had come by to collect the check from the couple next to me asked how my meal was. I told him I didn't know, since no-one had ever taken my order.  He asked if I wanted to sit back down. I explained to him that I was concerned about missing my connecting flight, and that I really just wanted to get some lunch  quickly.  Instead of letting me go, he gave me a rather nasty look and said "Well, if THAT'S the way you feel, SIR, maybe you /should/ go somewhere else."  I'm very, very glad I didn't give them my money, and if I'm going through Sky Harbor again, I don't intend to ever return.
Not only overpriced for too small of a portion (did expect that being in an airport), I did not anticipate the server being completely incompetent and rude! Needless to say, won't be back!

Ordered the fish tacos and they were good. As everyone has laminated very expensive. Great place to chill and relax while you are waiting to catch your flight. I'd go back if I was in the Phoenix airport.

Prompt service but poor food quality. Carne Asada was served cold.  Steak was ordered medium rare and served sliced, well done, dry and not fresh. Tasted like it was precooked and sat under heat lamp for an hour. French fries were stale and cold. I realize this is an airport eatery but if you're going to charge $23 for an entree, it needs to be better quality. Service was not an issue.

This was one of the best breakfasts I've had. I was here a couple years ago when seeing the Grand Canyon. Had a Pink Cadillac with a SouthWestern breakfast of home fried potatoes mixed with peppers and onions, bacon, scrambled eggs. Yeah, I know...What's the big deal right? It's all in the flavor! Amazing flavor and our waitress was the nicest and funniest person. I like when wait staff and servers have a sense of humor. She was what we needed. So was the Pink Cadillac! BTW, Tons of Tequilla in that baby!

#BarrioCafe #BarrioCafePorAvion #SeriouslyBadAssMexicanCuisine  I had the most delicious lunch on my way to San Francisco and the service was outstanding. Yolanda help me with the extensive menu and suggested my entree (allowing me to substitute the fries for a bed of spinach). I've been to the 16th street location twice while on vacation.   Carne Asada a la Ricardo: grilled skirt steak topped with caramel used onions, green onions, mushrooms, jalapeños, garlic and chorizo all over a pile of Barrio spicy fries with an avocado and pick del Gallo. $23   Organic: Tierras Organic Silver Tequila, organic agave nectar, pomegranate and grapefruit juice, and fresh lime with salted rim $14.25  Chata: award winning Agua de Horchata, Crema 1921 and Kahlua

If you have time in Phoenix airport, come to The Barrio Cafe! I love this place. This is the most inspired menu I've ever seen in my domestic travels, and the artwork is awesome. Is that a Chihuly light? The food is great, and there is an interesting cocktail menu. This is not just an over-priced beer and burger place. I love flying through Phoenix with a layover so I can come here. My favorites are the nachos (unexpected sweet and savory flavor), fish tacos, and seafood enchiladas. Oh and the Cadillacs. :) mucho gusto!

Meh, food was fine, but overpriced (even for airport food). There looks like a disconnect between the male and female servers: the male staff looks very professional in shirts and ties, but the females (even with "dress shirts" and ties) don't look professional at all, more like what a high school girl would consider "professional." (For more clarification, the men are dressed how you expect restaurant managers to dress, while the women were a tad on the sloppy or too-casual side). My server (well, most of the female servers) was inattentive, bringing me a refill for my drink when I was clearly finished with my meal, and all of the women seemed to congregate near the kitchen or next to the bar to chat and joke. There were far too many waiters and waitresses, and they could definitely make do with fewer.
Rating was due to service experience with wait staff.  Host staff were on point, give those girls kudos!  Coffee - fabulous

Not bad food, but nowhere close to worth the price. This is a sit down restaurant so plan on staying about 45 minutes for a meal. Located in the D gates of terminal 4 at Sky Harbor.  Again, the food was good and the service was alright but I will not be coming here again.
Good service and good posole verde.  Will order again when I am in terminal D at the Phoenix airport.

This seems like a mailed in effort from one of my favorite local chefs.  My breakfast sandwich was absolutely average and exceptionally messy given the fact that you are likely going to be eating it off your lap.  The bread was heavy and bland; I wound up discarding it.   One general complaint about the overall new restaurant plan.  I am absolutely a fan of the local restaurants in the airport but as I was in the Southwest terminal I couldn't find any reasonably priced dishes.  I find that interesting given the fact that the Southwest terminals are usually ground zero for families and young kids.  I feel bad for the mom of 4 who has no option but to spend $15 for some french toast at Barrio or LGO.  What happened to  the cheaper options?

Surprised to find Barrio Cafe here in the D.  Great breakfast, could not pass it up.  Bustling eatery serving creative Mexican fare & over 200 tequilas in cozy digs filled with folk art. Offerings Alcohol Beer Cocktails Coffee Comfort food Happy hour drinks Happy hour food Hard liquor Small plates Vegetarian options Wine  Best damn Taco's!

Does anyone know how to get in contact with this restaurant? I was charged 2 different times, one for $53.07 which was my bill total and another for $63.90 which was not bill. The drinks were great and it was close to my gate but not paying someone else's tab also lol

The story is as good as the food itself.   I'm going out on a limb here and saying this place deserves 5 stars just on the nachos alone. I know the signature dish is the puerco pibil, this will have to wait till my next visit. I was pleasantly surprised to have fresh spinach and blue cheese on my nachos platter. The cheese tasted like it was gourmet home made cheese. I like the story how authentic Mexican dishes with French influence plays a roll in the dishes served. Keep in mind this was what they served at the Phoenix Airport location. I really need to stop by the downtown location. My only complaint if I had one was the price being a little on the high side. $40 for two beers and a nachos plate. Honestly, you get what you pay for here though. I would totally do it again!  Great job Barrio Cafe!!!
Food was delicious . Food was hot. Breakfast was fantastic! Yum totally eat here again

Great service, amazing lunch! I had a long layover here and took one look at the menu before deciding this was my kind of Mexican food! The server sat me with all my luggage towards the back left side of the restaurant where it was nice and quiet. I ordered the shrimp and avocado salad and enjoyed every bite. I can easily say avocados are my favorite lunch fruit/veg and they are not commonly served in airports!  When I got done with my lunch I was able to plug in my laptop and get some work done - what a pleasant surprise Phoenix airport had to offer me this trip! Thanks to Barrio Cafe for easing the burden of traveling just a little bit. My server was super nice and left me alone when she saw that I was working. When I needed to checkout she was quick to run my card and get me out to my flight.

High prices, slow service.  15 bucks for a pollo poblano burrito with fries. Choice of salad or fries. After 15 min of waiting, I received my burrito with a salad. So I asked for my fries. They simply scraped the salad off the plate and plunked fries on top of the balsamic mess. My burrito was soggy, mediocre amount of chicken, and the vinegar taste was strong. Another thing I didn't like was that if you order takeout you cannot sit in the seating area. Dine in only. It's an airport. I don't have time to wait for someone to bring me a check when I'm trying to catch a plane. I'm not stopping here again. Pizza Hut probably would've been worth the walk...another note, the drinks in the cold case were warm so they had a bucket on the counter with ice. This ensured colder drinks but it was crowded and I almost pulled a muscle trying to lean over to get the drippy water on the other end of the counter.  I don't understand why the cashier couldn't have just handed me one as she saw me struggle. Just a negative experience all around. :( See pix.

I begrudgingly hate going to the airport, but be-still my heart... There's a Barrio Cafe here! I was so excited about my find, I spent my time enjoying a delicious plate of Chiliquiles Verdes while waiting for my flight to depart.  The Chiliquiles Verdes cheered me up right away. The tortillas had a crispy texture that was just the right amount of thickness. The baked seasoned tortillas supported the weight of the rich ranchero sauce that embraced them.  With all this carb loading, the French Pressed coffee prevented me from falling into a deep food coma so I didn't miss my flight!  Barrio Cafe definitely helped kick off my morning to a great start!

Food was good but service was terrible. Had a server named Victor. I ordered a margarita with no salt and it came out with salt. I let him know I had ordered no salt and asked for a new one. He took my drink, walked away, and then I watched him take a napkin and wipe the rim of my glass and bring it back. I really hate salt so I told him I saw him just wipe the glass, but instead of apologizing and getting me a new, fresh drink he got attitude and said I needed to taste the drink to see if I tasted the salt! Are you kidding me - how unprofessional. He then got attitude with my friend who was with me and asked if she had something to say also.  I will never go back - decent tasting taco but that kind of service is inexcusable!!

First, I hate leaving below par reviews for any place I go but I will be fair in this review.   A nice Airport restaurant with a decent menu. I can't fully review this restaurant as we were only served drinks.  The margaritas were good, not the best I've ever had but they held their own. Prices were ok, for being a Terminal restaurant, pricey for other standards. We were seated quickly and the hostess was nice. Our server came to the table some time later and we ordered two margaritas. My wife ordered the pink one and I ordered the spicier one, can't remember the names of them now as its been a few weeks.  The restaurant was busier so it took alittle time to receive our drinks and the server was ok. After we got our drinks our server went on her break, which isn't a problem at all, but the server that took over for her was absent. I mean, we never saw him/her. We would have had another round but after waiting 30 minutes with no server even after hitting the call button on the table we finally hit the Payment button. Still, no server, we finally had to wave another server down just to get our bill.  Overall I could do without going back to this spot, though the margaritas were good they aren't worth the wait.

After two visits - terrible.  Cochinita Pibil tacos dry and tasteless.  And with French fries!  Guacamole should be advertised as chopped (at least as well as you can with a spoon by a server who told us it was a pain to do guacamole tableside when it was busy!) avocado not guacamole.  Service seemed just plain uninterested.  Prices not justified at all for what you are going to experience.

I have eaten here several times for Breakfast and Lunch. Normally the service can be challenging and a bit understaffed. Today it was that and the food came out cold. First time sending it back. I will say the server was nice and the replacement food was on point. Glad we had plenty of time.

Don't go if you are a penny pincher but if you like flavorful food with some creativity this is a great place. Not a burrito style Mexican food. The fish tacos were incredible and the slow roasted pork in banana leaf was the best Removing all star as server was highly rude and un professional

Two strikes you're out Barrio Cafe. I love supporting local businesses and have been so pleased to see the arrival of so many to the airport but when I'm at the airport I must put efficiency first. This is where barrio Cafe sadly fails. In the future I will stop in for a drink but I will only sit at the bar and nothing more. This is because the service is sadly some of the worst I've experienced. On two separate occasions I've eaten here and both times the lack of service have almost cost me to miss my flight. After serving the food the wait staff seems to disappear and it's impossible to find them. I would ask and ask and then when I note my need to hurry for fear of missing my flight I have been snidely commented to by the staff. The food and drinks are good but I think the customer service and efficiency needs major improvement if they want to be successful in an airport environment.
It's ok. Nothing special. Slow, spotty service. The food is 3-Star. The service, 2-Star. The price 1-Star. The price alone will haunt you.

Sampling the menu here at the airport. Got the chicken burrito plate. It was really good they give you a lot of chicken in the meal. Chicken was grilled and well seasoned. Also ordered the guacamole side.

I will preface this as it is good for airport food... But.... I imagine the airport location is not doing the legacy very good. The food is good... Except dried cranberries in the guac??? :/ (I ate around those). Chips were stale.. I think someone else mentioned that also and my posole was cold. I saw someone else commented on cold food so looks like they have a little problem. Also the waitress was completely overwhelmed and it wasn't that busy, but To her defense I think she was the only waitress in the whole place and she was hustling and very sweet. Overall... Wasn't bad and flavors were good and authentic, but when you say things like world famous on your menu it kinda sets the bar pretty high. If they hadn't I may not have been so disappointed.

Cochinito pibil is phenomenal. Melt in your mouth pork. Very, very flavorful. It also comes with a marinated onions, salsa, and savory (smashed) potatoes. I was skeptical at first, but it blew my nomnomnom mind at first bite. Wow... Some of the best Mexican food I've had.

I was pressed for time and wanted to eat somewhere with table service in between flights. With only 3 stars in Yelp, I was a little hesitant, but I didn't have time to look all over for other restaurants. I was pleasantly surprised!!  I was greeted immediately by the pleasant hostess who seated me right away. My server was super kind and helped me with any questions I had, giving suggestions along the way.  I ended up getting the fish tacos and I'm so happy I did!!! The plate had 3 tacos stuffed full with fried mahi mahi and avocado on corn tortillas. It came with a lovely side salad with delicious balsamic vinaigrette.  Great service! My water glass was always full. My empty plates were promptly cleared. My check was brought immediately when I asked.

If you're in the airport, definitely go here! I love this place for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The service is extremely fast and the food is actually really good for airport food. I always get a traditional two egg breakfast which comes with meat, potatoes and toast. Can't go wrong there. The steak tacos: AMAZING! What a hidden gem. The only negative is that I think the fries are way too over seasoned. Someone in the back has a heavy hand! Of course it is pricey, but it's the airport so that is to be expected. This is my go to spot when I fly out of Phoenix, and I travel a lot.
Heck ya... one of my all time favs comes to Sky Harbor!!!

Wow, worst service ever even for an airport, waited 15 minutes an no one showed.   Went back after realizing no where else close to get food and beverage. Seriously then listened to wait person complain about I was guy who left and complained of lousy service. So they waited on me immediately?   No said we'll be right with you after I'd already been sitting 10 minutes  If you're going to bitch about your customers, maybe choose not within their hearing range?!? Wow  yep worst service ever to go with over priced food and watery Bloody Mary . Try and get at least one thing right

Nice little spot within the Southwest Terminal of the airport, the food is pretty good all things considered, they do have some hybrid food mixing Mexican and American influences.  I had a dish that had french fries in it, was pretty decent.  If I was in the terminal, I'd definitely eat here again.

Very nice looking in-airport restaurant and the service at the bar is above average. However my breakfast experience was terrible. I order the chilaquiles and when they come out, they look different from what I'm accustomed. I give them a try anyway as they do look appetizing. Turns out the tortilla was cold, almost as if it had been just pulled out of the packet. I ask the waitress if that's how the dish was meant, since I'd never seen chilaquiles assembled in this format and she said no and took it back. When she returns the tortillas were warm but my over medium egg was also now fully cooked. I ate 1/2 and then notice my potatoes have 2-3 small chunks of pork meat. Btw, I don't eat pork and the dish did no describe to include any meat. I confirm with the waitress again and her simple response was, it must have just slipped in. All-in-all, I'd avoid this place for food but would give it another go for drinks.

I was craving burritos so I figured I would stop here to eat since it was near my gate.  FOOD: okay The GUACAMOLE was probably the best thing we had.  They make it fresh for you at table-side so you can request what you want or don't want in it.  The CHIPS are kind of hard though, so after awhile, my jaw started to hurt. haha!   SERVICE: so-so At first, the waiter was on top of everything -- friendly, patient, attended to our table quickly.  But after we got our food, the service was horrible.  Our water glasses remained empty, it took forever to get our check, and forever to get our card back.  The waiter seemed to be too busy flirting with the hostess or something.  I guess he didn't come here to work....  PRICE: typical for the airport
Too many drain flies for me. Food was cold. Bloody Mary was oh so nasty. Move onto another terminal or go to La Grande Orange.
Big fan of Bario in town.  Ordered a margarita and the glass it came in could almost pass for a shot glass.   $10.00 later.... a shame for so little.

Food is usually excellent.  Small portions.  My gripe......10.00 for chips and salsa!!,,!,!,!,,,!!,!omg.  If you want to be a fucking Mexican restaurant in Phoenix, charge 14.00 for three small street tacos, and charge customers for a bowl of chips and salsa.  I will walk to the other establishments in in C or A.  You seem to have lost sight of your roots.  If I spend 35.00 for drinks and food, 2.00 worth of chips and salsa seem to be a no brainier.  I can understand if they order a water and chips and salsa but not for paying customers!!!! Never again barrio!

Last day of our business trip and one of the guys just wanted to get to the airport and drink as you can loose your job if you get a DUI while on business. So straight to the airport it was and since it was on the companies dime, we're going to pay the outrageous airport meal fees.  The margaritas must have been good or the guys were thirsty because they tanked the first one and took it easy on the second.  Good customer service. We weren't rushed as all the business travelers were starting to pour in.   I thought my fried shrimp and fish dish was really good and it appeared my co-workers enjoyed their meals as well.  As we were leaving, as crowded as it seemed, we could still get through without tripping over the other customers with our hand carry in tow.  One thing I was mostly impressed with, the murals on the wall. Even my tatted co-worker thought it was tastefully done and fun.  I would definitely have a meal here again if I ever have to go through this Southwest terminal again.

Let me first say that I visited the the one in Phoenix. Amazing food, decor, and service. I had the filet mignon, the infamous guacamole, and flan. Wow, and it's rare that I end with desert. Get there before 5pm, place fills up quickly. I love the murals on the parking lot walls. It reminds me of home (Philly). I will be back!!

Ummmm.... I almost do not want to review this place, but must give you the warning to avoid it IF you can.   So hopefully you will read this before stopping by. Worst breakfast I have had. Airport food has improved significantly in the past 10-20 years. Not this one.    Wait for lunch which starts at 10:00, they say it's much better.  Service was nice though. So the staff deserves a 3 star.

Nice place to grab a drink and some  Mexican food while waiting for a flight. The server was busy so the service was kind of slow but we were not in a hurry so all is good. The beers  were cold and the Guac was delish!

I don't expect a whole lot from airport food, but this place is downright terrible. Especially when you consider the cost of the food!  We were sat promptly, but the hostess didn't bring menus (she seemed SUPER uninterested in her job), so when the waitress showed up a minute later, we were already frazzled trying to order drinks, but we made it. She took our drink order and thankfully gives us time to look things over for our food order.  When our waitress came back with our drinks, she joked that she didn't take a sip...ok...haha...but maybe she should have. My $10 original margarita was nothing more than water and lime. There wasn't even a hint of a taste of tequila in it. My husband's $14 margarita wasn't any better. For the cost, I shouldn't have to guess if the bartender remembered to put tequila in our drinks!  We attempted to find out waitress so we could ask for our drinks to be remade. She was no where in sight. In fact, we couldn't get anyone's attention.  Not willing to find out if our $17 tacos would be equally as bad, we left.  If you want weird and not great service, and terrible and terribly overpriced drinks--this place is for you! Not sure how the food is...so eat at your own risk.

I decided to try Barrio out while waiting for a Sunday evening Southwest flight back to California. It was a great place to relax and enjoy a drink and salad for 45 minutes while waiting on a flight. Cocktails were expensive but that's to be expected in the airport restaurant/bar.

Inside the airport at the 'D' Gates, you will find two restaurants with sit down options. Barrio Cafe is one of them, but they lure you in because in addition to standard tables and chairs, they also have couches and lounge chairs.  Sign at the entrance says wait to be seated, but with only two wait staff running around a considerable area, I wasn't optimistic one of them would greet and seat me. Eventually, after a minute wait, a waiter with a smile on his face, yelled across the room as he was delivering someone's order, "Seat yourself, anywhere is fine."  I found a nice two-seated, black leather couch in the corner. I occupied one of the seats, and my bags the other. A friendly waitress made her way to my area after about five minutes and delivered a menu and took my drink order. I wasn't that hungry, but I felt I might be on the verge of a migraine, so getting water to take my meds was paramount to me. I also ordered a Coca Cola to help give me a jolt of energy. I think I waited another 5 minutes for the drinks to arrive.  When you are in pain and wanting to take your meds, the wait for water is exceptionally noticeable.  The menu didn't really have anything appealing, so I ordered $10 guacamole from the appetizer menu. I was intrigued that mashed avocados could be listed at that price. Apparently you pay for the entertainment value. The waitress wheeled a cart that looked more like the bus boy cart in front of my coffee table and asked me if I wanted all of the ingredients. I said yes even though I had no idea what special ingredients might be included in this masterpiece. The waitress sprinkled, scooped and mixed about seven different items together, many of which I had no idea what they were. She then presented me with a small, red, mixing bowl with some mashed and some chunked avocado with bright red pomegranate seeds on top. This was highly unusual to me. I tried it, but the pomegranate seeds added to the mix didn't really do anything to enhance the flavor. I ate a few more bites to see if it would grow on me, but alas, I left the majority of the creation sitting in the bowl and promptly fell asleep on the couch using my bags as my pillow.  My waitress was kind enough not to disturb me, but she promptly attended to me when I awoke 30 minutes later asking if I wanted anything else. I told her that I wouldn't be getting anything else, but that I would be here for another 30 minutes since my flight was delayed. We settled the tab and I tipped her handsomely to compensate her for the loss of new customers that might have sat in her section on the couch.  The service was okay, the food selection and guacamole was...meh, especially considering the prices, the comfortable lounge seating was a nice perk, and with limited choices in this section of the airport, I might be forced to return, but hopefully not.

My daughter was ready to enjoy a fantastic lunch at this well-placed eatry. However, the way that she was treated was unconscienceable. My daughter is a beautiful brown-black girl who is open-minded and accepting of others. But these people who are descendents of immigrants from Europe, waiting on and serving my daughter wanted to strike a negative chord in the heart of a gentle soul. After their negative treatment, she left the restaurant telling them she did not want "this." And by this meaning, not just the food, but that kind of treatment. I applaud her courage.

If your choice is to not eat and starve. Or eat here. Please choose to starve. Dirty and gross. Rude staff. And horrid inedible food. I don't usually do negative reviews but this place was that bad. Even for airport food. Worst I've ever had. There are far better choices at this airport. Please make a better decision than I did.
Save your time and money. Food was terrible and cold. Servise was the worst! Stay away!

Eh what can I say, its airport food. This place is not the worst Mexican food I've had at an airport but it definitely wouldn't do very well as a regular restaurant. I had the carne asada tacos and thought they were quite bland. The cheese they added to them was more sad than anything and it was dry and crumbly. My boyfriend had the AZ burrito and it was again, just ok. What I found to be really weird was that they had no chips on the menu( or at least from what I saw ). My boyfriend got French fries instead of chips since that's what they offered. I thought this was a bit odd as the flavors clashed a bit. I'd probably try the place next door the next time I went to PHX.

One seat open at the bar but my wife and I couldn't use it because "I have to have each person at the bar have their own seat". When asked why the answer was "because this is a dining area". What a fucking joke.

Quick service and happy employees very friendly and the food is delicious and tasty!!!! Had their fish tacos must try with their salsa!!!!! Definitely I will eat there every time ill be in the airport before my flight!!!

Had a couple hours to waste before the flight, so stopped here. Bacardi was our server, pretty chill with kind of a hippie vibe. The stars are mainly for her and her good service, because the food was just ok. THAT HORCHATA THO...yummers :)!!!!

Was headed out of town for the weekend and thanks for a flight delay I had some time to kill and thought it would be cool to check out what Terminal 4 has to offer now so I checked things and out and made my way on over to Barrio Café.   Ok one of the things I like about Phoenix Sky Harbor, they are supporting locally owned restaurants and bringing them into the terminals for others to enjoy, I think it's a great thing. https://skyharbor.com/pdf/Terminal_4_L3_Current.pdf I like the look of Barrio Café, the art work is cool.   I think there is a lot of improvement to be made with the hostess and there crew, when I 1st got there I told the host I was a party of one, she gave some other person a menu and told them to sit me at the bar table area facing the people walking to their gates,  walked me to the spot, put menu down and walked away, not once did they check to see if this chair belonged to someone else, maybe the drink should tipped them off, told the person whose seat I just stole I was sorry, walked back up to the podium and gave them back my menu, then they put me at a table for 4 with 3 other guest who didn't even know each other, and this was a bench seat, so I had to ask the man if he would mind moving the bench so I could sit down.  This was not cool, I was so very close to saying screw this shit I'm out. Since I was at table with a bunch of strangers I didn't know and room was limited my idea of reading my book while eating a meal was no longer available.  Barely had room for my purse on the seat because everyone but me had a carry-on bag. Also at the table next to me a man was sat there, and he waited for about 10 minutes before anyone came to him so he walked up the bar to order his own beer, but when he left his table the host put 2 people at it, he came back and saw no room for him anymore.   Our server was Victor, he was a friendly guy just very over worked, I even heard him tell the host not to place anymore people in his area until he can clear some tables.  Again this is something I shouldn't be hearing.  Ok so I had some time to check out Barrio Cafes web site while waiting and learned 2 things, supposedly this is truly excellent, very authentic Mexican food and BC notes on its website that its food is not deliberately chile-hot, wants the flavor of the seasoniongs & spices to revel themselves.  So don't expect heat, no chips no salsa either.  After looking the menu over I went with the burrito pollo pablano , it had grilled chicken breast with roasted poblano peppers, caramelized onions & garlic with goat cheese and a cream reduction and had the choice of salad or spicy French fires (because spicy French fries are way more authentic than beans or rice?) I picked the side salad, it was salad greens with diced tomato and goat cheese on top of it with a balsamic dressing, it was good, enjoyed the flavors.  The burrito though, I had high hopes, the chicken looked like the stuff you can get at the store, the deli fresh grilled chicken breast, it was perfectly sliced with grill marks, had no flavor at all, the peppers, onions and garlic was bland, no flavor, the goat cheese didn't have that bite it normally has, the cream reduction was like a thin alfredo sauce but bland. This entire burrito lacked flavor & spice and not the heat type of spice.  I wasn't impressed with Barrio Café , even if it was the airport addition and not sure if I would wonder on over the downtown Phoenix location .  And I really wanted to like it, So thrilled that Sky Harbor is putting in locally owned places, just think they missed when they added this one, but good news is Los Taquitos is almost done being built.

We had a long layover today and had eaten here before. We walked all around Terminal 4 to explore the food choices, but ended up back here close to our gate. We kept thinking that we weren't that impressed with the food and prices last time; we should have listened to our gut. We ordered the guacamole and the cochinita pibil tacos (which they are known for). They first brought out the tacos piled high with fries, but we ordered a side salad. When they brought it back out, the side salad was so small. We were both shocked at how small it was. $14 for a taco platter and a tiny, tiny side salad is steep! The guacamole was not cheap either at about $12-13, and it had cranberries in it. Server was not very friendly. I recommend you go to one of the burrito/torta places in another gate area. It will be almost half the price.

The Good: +  Great service!  Really friendly staff and bartenders will help you pass the time. +  Extensive menu for an airport.    The Not So Good: -  The food was not good.  My chorizo was burnt to a char and it was supposed to be the star of the dish.  The redeeming factor was the sunny side up eggs. -  Incredibly expensive for what you get.  We get it, it's an airport.  But when you're paying close to 15 dollars for a plate of two basic eggs you're getting shafted. -  Slow service for food, quick service for drinks.

A bit overpriced but that is to be expected at the airport. Very good nachos! Amazing grapefruit margarita. They do not serve water at the table unless you ask. They try to sell you bottled water when you leave. Order the chips and guacamole. They make it at the table! Great service. I would eat here again

I sat at the bar and ordered the Barrio salad and house red. The salad was extremely fresh and with every bite you get an assortment of flavor. Honestly one of the best salads I've ever had, let alone in an airport. I travel once, sometimes twice, a week and I know airport food... This place raises the bar. When I'm back in Phoenix, I will definitely eat here again!

For airport food, this is pretty good. The prices are typical of airport prices but not crazy. I had a glass of wine and the steak tacos (3 tacos and french fries) and I paid about $23.00.  The service: I sat at the bar. The bar tenders were friendly, One Hispanic guy and a lady who had a lot of tattoos ( I don't remember their names lol). The guy was great. he was super friendly and helpful and just fun. The lady was a little more reserved; she seemed annoyed with one of the patrons but she wasn't serving me so whatevs. The guy who was serving me was helpful with suggestions and was quick with service.  The food: Eh. The tacos were alright; nothing to rave about by any means. They had steak, a cabbage slaw and pico on top. It came with a side of mild salsa. The fries were the best part. They are seasoned and steak cut. The menu is a good size but not a lot of variety.  The wine: great! hard to mess up Chardonnay.   Overall: If I was every in the airport again and wanted some mexican food I might stop here again. I don't think I'd spend that kind of money again on tacos though.  *shrug* I guess I won't be back.

Two words, SERVICE SUCKS! Plain & simple. I am personally embarrassed  for  people that I'm watching that are having to wait so long to even get service. I'm just stuck here because my flight is delayed.

On our way to Cabo and had 2 hours in the Phoenix airport so based upon a previous amazing experience hiked the 2 miles from our gate area to gats A/B to hit Barrio Café. Again it was amazingly good and for an airport restaurant that is something. Prices are decent. Food is tasty and ample. Service was attentive. Dos Equis Amber on tap. What more could you ask?  We actually liked it much more than the original Barrio in downtown Phoenix. We think you will too so give it a try. Oh, the Mexican food we had was every bit the equal to what we had in Baja.

I am such a picky eater, not one thing I want to eat.  Hope the soup is ok.  Soup was ok, but small.  I have to go find something else to eat.  Didn't get the $9 chips and salsa.  Great service by Bacardi.
Arizona burro was really great. ... strange it comes with fries or salad, should come with chops and hot sauce but fries were good too. Chipolte ketchup nice and spicy if you like chipolte.

I arrived super early for a flight and was looking for a place to enjoy some breakfast and a beer (way early in the morning). I happened upon Barrio cafe, which was right next to my gate. I sat at the bar, ordered a beer, and took a look at their menu. They don't have a very big selection, especially for breakfast. I can't fault them for that - they're a restaurant in an airport. They're also expensive - again, I don't fault them too much for that. The food came out quickly, the bartender was nice and helpful. It helped me accept that my vacation in Arizona was over.

The best part is the ketchup- it's a little spicy, has smoked flavor to it, overall very satisfying. However, guacamole, enchiladas and fish tacos were all lacking some binding component to taste good. Guacamole was freshly made basically in front of us. That's nice. But I'd add more cilantro and onion to it.  Enchiladas had too much butter. Really, butter was all I could taste pretty much. Scampi shrimp on top of them was very good but I wish the dish had more shrimp and less butter. Fish tacos were rather bland, unfortunately.  The murals are pretty cool and the service is quick. Summary on the food - good house made ketchup and scampi shrimp, good guacamole, but everything else is on the blandish side.

If only the service was as good as the food then this place could be 5 stars! The Mexican French toast paired with a spicy Bloody Mary hit the spot. Now if only we were able to get our water or drinks refilled. Didn't have the best service last time we are here either. Too bad!

I have flown numerous times and never, once at an airport have I been kicked out of a place because I wasn't eating their food. I've been at the airport for almost 9 hours due to airplane problems. Ate at this place this morning. There are no community tables or an area to really eat except in the benches by the terminals. The lady was rude. Kicked out flight attendants on a lay over as well. Just rude. Ps the food wasn't all that great. Ended up throwing out half of my burrito that was 9$  waste of money

We were so good, and got to the airport really early, so we had some time to kill.  This is just the place to do it.  (Hot tip:  be seated in the tequila tasting room, it is very quiet and intimate. You would never have thought you were in an airport.   We shared the Arizona burrito: pork chile verde in a burrito, topped with tomatillo salsa, and cheese, with two over easy eggs.  It was delicious and we ate every last bite.  The Bloody Mary was very good and the service was excellent.  So, if you are ever held over at PHX, this is a pretty cool place to hang out.

I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. Nothing boxed or packaged, I know because I inquired, I'm a health food junkie.  (This seemed to be the healthiest spot in my terminal). I got the fish tacos with a salad. The salad was super good quality and the balsamic dressing was GOOOOD! My reason for only 4 stars is the fish portions were VERY small. But I know it's a business and they need to profit. But a tad bigger pieces would have been better. Also, the staff was professional and friendly.

This was a pleasant surprise for airport food, yes its pricey but at least its worth it.  They have killer french press coffee, they bring you a big carafe for 2 that makes at least 5-6 cups.  I ordered the chilaquiles which were tasty and my husband had the Mexican omelet.  The service was really good too, since we were in a time crunch they served us pretty quick.  If in the area again I would definitely come back and try the cochinita pibil witch is supposed to be the house specialty.

Terminal 4 gate D. Table service and service is SLOW. If you are in a hurry, go somewhere else. We would have gone to La Grande Orange but they don't have enough seating. Barrio has Limited vegetarian options and no vegan options. They do not even have beans. My husband ordered fish tacos and said they were bland. I ordered the torta Barrio and although the bread was good it was just ok overall, and they left the seeds in the Chile which I don't like.

There's two things wrong with this place.  1. The bar stools are huge and have no backs.  Why is this a problem?  I have nowhere to hang my carry on/backpack and the size of the stools leaves less people at the bar...dumb.  2. Very few outlets to charge electronics while having a drink...very dumb.   One would think the designer would have thought of something that simple.  Didn't bother having a drink(s) because of it.  Charging my phone was more important than paying $8 for a $3 beer.

Definitely airport food! Don't ever order to share cuz they will charge a dollar fifty for a second sleep whether you use it or not. The Bloody Mary was really spicy and thick the food was okay but then again airport food. And $30 for one drink and one meal to share course!

Liked it here with great service and good food.  Then I saw the bartender grab six dirty glasses with his bare hands, put them aside in a sink, never washed his hands and grabbed new glasses and filled them with beer and other alcohol!!  Dirty dirty dirty!!  Glad I didn't order any alcohol from there!
Plenty of room for an airport restaurant. Food is good and prices are not to bad. Located on the D concourse in terminal 4.

The airport can be such a drag. All the hot bodies, angry travelers and yelling children can be quite a buzz kill. We needed a pick me up before heading home. Popped into Barrio for drinks. We were seated in the middle at a small barish table. It was so hot and loud. We saw the exterior bar open up and asked to move. No problem. Ahhhh we were already feeling better.  We had a great waitress who took cars of us the whole time. We started with a bloody Maria for me and a margarita for Derek. Followed with a 16 oz beer and what do you know, you can add a shot of Jameson on for $4. Yes please. Great break in between flights.

Sat at the bar while waiting during my layover between flights.  It was cool to see the bartenders have some rapport with some of the passing customers.  It gave it a "divey/neighbourhood" feel.    I had the fish tacos which were OK.  The fries that came with it kinda sucked.  They were pretty stale.  The ketchup was pretty good, it had spicy kick to it.  At $15 for three tacos however it's a bit over priced even for airport food.  Sitting at the bar you're able to witness some stuff.  I should've followed my instincts and just pushed my tacos away.  Hygiene wasn't great with the staff.  One bartender got choked up and started coughing...immediately proceeded to make drinks with out washing his hands.  Another came by to pick up some cut limes clearing her throat over them, they were unwrapped. This is after I received my meal and got given silverware that looked a little dingy.  To make matters worst...a 1/4 way through my flight my stomach did not feel so good.  Luckily my flight was short and my place is near the airport, otherwise I would had blown up the bathroom (no pun intended)  Overall...stay away from here if you plan on grabbing a quick bite between flights.  It's overpriced and mediocre at best...and food poisoning on a flight is no fun. The star is more for the atmosphere of the bar area.  Bartenders should clean up a bit more though

Guacamole was interesting with the dried cranberries, it was chunky and tasty but needed salt. The chips were horrible! Whoever provides their chips should be fired, those are not chips.  They were too thick and stale. Gross. I tried to enjoy the guacamole, but the chips absolutely ruined it.  Service was pretty good until it got busy. I would stop for a drink, but not being able to enjoy guacamole and chips at a mexican food restaurant is tragic.

Average at best. The marinade on the steak was good but otherwise the tacos were just like you'd get anywhere.   A lot of flights are delayed so service wasn't stellar, I sat for an hour after my meal had been taken away. I was never asked if I wanted anything else, and had to flag my server down for the check eventually.   I wouldn't recommend it, but it wasn't terrible. Definitely overpriced

Yeah.... I'm going to go ahead and rubber stamp all of the bad reviews on here. The house margarita was way too sour. Barely drinkable and tiny for $10. I ordered a side salad with my tacos which came barely dressed at all and had no flavor. The tacos I order were ok, but left me wanting more. I literally left here and went to another terminal with more options to get a second drinks and appetizer before my flight.
For a regular restaurant this this is very good. For an airport location it is great. Great service good prices. Kuali camaron awesome pork tacos good. Fries ok.

I assume this place is owned by the same people who own the 16th street location but if it is, OMG what are you doing polluting your brand?  Stopped there the other night before a flight and was excited because I like the orginal.  No ambience and I had this waitress who looked and acted miserable.  She also made me feel rushed.  So, she pushes the special tequila margarita and i get one.  Just okay.  Then I ask if you can mix and match tacos.. don't want four of the same taco.  No.  Then I order a  chile plate and it was so cold and gross it was inedible.  I sent it back and asked for guamamole and chips which was actually quite good.  Although when the waitress was preparing it tableside she seemed bored and irritated.   To her credit she didn't charge me for the chile.  Real disappointment... go next door to the Grande Orange cafe.

Terrible, terrible service. We waited 15 minutes for the overwhelmed server to show up and she was a little grumpy.  Requested a bottle of wine and were told that the bottle we wanted was out of stock, so the server offered a recommendation. Turns out the recommendation was also out of stock as was our 3rd choice. Ordered the table side guacamole and (1) it was not table side (2) the chips were stale. The server let us know that all of there chips were stale so we made do. The guacamole itself was great. The main course  took too long to come out but was wonderful when it did arrive. I had the pork my wife had a shrimp appetizer.  Overall it took longer than an hour and 15 minutes; way too long for an airport.

Warning, don't go to this place if you're looking for good authentic Mexican food. This place is terrible. I was happy when I got seated right away but only to find out why. Food taste like it's from a can bought from a low end grocery store. They don't serve complimentary chips. It will cost you at least $9 and they are pretty bad. I ordered posole and it tasted like something out of a can. Maybe my expectation is higher than average but I don't think so.  The only good thing are the people serving. They are professional and nice. The cook and management should be fired. Terrible terrible terrible!  Go somewhere else.

This restaurant is a bit overpriced even for being an airport restaurant. Their guacamole is huge which is good if you are sharing with others however I was alone and requested a half size but my request could not be met. It is made table side which I think is unnecessary and they didn't even wear gloves which was kind of a let down.
I stop here when ever I fly thru PHX if I have the time. I get the Americano with , sometimes coffee sometimes taquila yummy

I had a rather long layover at the airport and was searching for something light and filling to eat.  All of the salads at the neighboring restaurant were pre-made and covered in cheese, which I personally do not like.  Of all of the available choices I thought that Barrio Cafe was a decent option.    I ordered the fish tacos and a side salad.  The food was pretty good, however they could have gone a lot lighter on the breading of the fish or offered a grilled option.  The flavor of the food was really good and so was the service.  I would consider going back if I was in that terminal again.

First of all we LOVE barrio cafe and barrio queen in Phoenix and Scottsdale. If we had to pick a last meal it would be their guacamole, pork tacos and posole. This is why we were soooooo excited to see barrio at the airport. Very sadly it did not measure up at all :( The posole soup did not have hominy and radishes like at the other restaurants, it seriously seemed like they just threw pork in some broth. We also ordered the pork tacos and all of the pork was very fatty, I couldn't even eat it. I know this is not like the other restaurants at all, something is very off here!

So overpriced its unreal. My boyfriend and I wanted a snack before our flight so we asked for chips and salsa, the waiter said "its $10 for a tiny bowl of them" .. no thank you. So we split an order of steak tacos - which were 3 for $14.. no rice or beans or anything, just 3 street tacos. That's almost $5 a taco, insane. So for 2 bud lights, a 9oz glass of wine ($18) and one order of tacos (3) our bill was $45. Crazy!

I travel about 80% for work. Anyone that says this is the best airport food ever clearly do not travel often. The food is gross and overpriced and the service is terrible. My trip and meals are company funded so cost is not the issue for me -- it's all about food and service quality.   Too bad Sky Harbor management isn't reading the reviews - maybe it would improve. Clearly Barrio's is ignoring them. I am so disappointed that they removed all of the other restaurants from D Gates.  If you have time I recommend you walk over to C Gates....There's a small Paradise Bakery, Cinnabon, and (if you must) a Burger King.
I liked my food, Waiter made great recommendations. Excellent service.

It was fairly good at first but my plate came with a lot of grease on it and after consuming half of my plate all that was left to taste was a overwhelming grease flavor. Also, the French press coffee (although it looks quite good) is not worth the $4 a cup.  There was a great amount of variety here though which was great to find and it was so close to my gate!

Nachos only... I was very hungry when my delayed flight finally landed but really, some of the better nachos I've had.  The chips were fresh corn tortilla chips and the fresh avocado really finished off this interesting dish nicely.  Why was it interesting? The "nachos" weren't greasy at all, they were topped with sauteed spinach, mushrooms, onions and jalapenos, all sprinkled with a little bit of bleu cheese and a little bit of chorizo! The grilled chicken was almost non-existent but I didn't care because the veggies were so good.  Yes, I was skeptical but pleasantly surprised how good they were!  There was also sour cream and classic salsa on the side but you really didn't need the sour cream.  Even if you're a purist, try them if you're feeling adventurous, they are worth it. Great, quick service too - nice if you're connecting flight doesn't give you much time to eat something.

Service was fine. Boyfriend got the fish tacos which were decent but overpriced. The restaurant could benefit from some vegetarian or vegan options. The best they could offer me was chips and salsa for $9. I was surprised that a Mexican restaurant didn't have some rice and beans and moreover that it does not cater whatsoever to plant-based eating.

I really wanted a restaurant feel when I landed in the airport. I had a two hour layover so I wanted to make sure I got a good meal. Barrio Café fit what I was craving so I decided to go.  Our waitress was incredibly nice. The food was a bit slow getting out. I got the burrito (I forget what this one was called) and while it was good, I wanted something more from it. It didn't have anything exciting or different for me to mention. And I know it's airport food, but I was excited to eat in Arizona because I've heard so much about the food. I chose barrio fries on the side. There really isn't anything special about them. They are fries with spicy seasoning on top. For airport food, this is a great place. A little pricey but still decent.

As far as barrio cafes go I hope this isn't your first experience because the original is amazing but we are in an airport and when you live in airports like I do it's refreshing to see local restaurants representing inside the terminals.  I say restaurants because Le grand orange is right next door where..... PS. you can get a glass of wine for half of what I'm paying here in the barrio.   The food at barrio is always spectacular if your looking for a 16 dollar shrimp quesadilla but if your looking for complimentary chips and salsa and a glass of wine.... pass. Because the 9 dollar chips and salsa  they serve is... sorry to be rude not worth it and in my Phoenician opinion are not what should be served in any PHX Mexican restaurant ever! and the message the chef is sending comes through loud and clear. Don't come here unless you wanna spend money and trust my recipes. But I will because then again I am stuck inside terminal four and spent 30 bucks on wine and pizza last time so at lease its something different and the service is always phenomenal.
