This is surprisingly inspired and delicious food in an airport. The restaurant is true to its roots and the passion is evident in even the "simplest" dishes. The quesadilla borracha and empanizado del mar are great starts; we do the tacos with fish or shrimp every time we travel through. The only downside is the prices, which are to be expected in an airport meal--they're no reflection on the restaurant.  Staff are friendly and food is relatively quick; if you have angst about time, order to-go at the side bar.

Food was just not good! To be fair, it was fresh, but it was a poor combination of flavors. I ordered the grilled chicken tacos. They came drowned, and I mean totally smothered, in goat cheese and some type of cream sauce. It was literally dripping when I tried to eat it. The salad had a very light dressing, but was unremarkable. The service was bad. I felt ignored because I was seated way in the back away from everyone when there were tables available elsewhere. Took my server 10 minutes to greet me, and he seemed shocked when I told Jim I was ready to order. Once my food came he never checked on me again. I placed my credit card on he table when I was finished to give them a hint I was ready to go. This just reinforced my belief that you can't get decent Mexican food outside of California. Sorry PHX! Still love ya tho...

Came in again.  I know a gluten for punishment.  However today I had a much different experience.  My servers name was Reeni, and she was great.  I had the chips and guacamole which were good.  I then had the posole and it was out of this world.  Reeni thank you for taking the time explaining the restaurant as well as the food.  I will return.
Very good fish tacos, and the salad was tiny but delicious. My daughter had a quesadilla with barrio fries. With limited options in the airport - this place was pretty good!

Place is packed (Gate D @ PHX) -granted, it's day before Thanksgiving. Having the Burrito Arizona - nicely done. Moist pork and tomatillo sauce w a sprinkle of Oaxaca cheese. Dee-vinnne!!!    Love the Barrio fries w/ house ketchup (spicy)!

Had a long layover flying into Phoenix. Server was great with kids and the food had some flavor. Only critique is the menu is a-little complicated to read through. Also, they do not serve chips and salsa

Yes, I am the traveler who seeks - even during airport layovers - to maximize the culinary adventure. Because I don't know who doesn't need a fresh meal and a stiff drink while slogging across almost the entire nation in nine hours....  Things one needs, then: a fresh meal. I know airport-fresh should be flitting around here in air quotes, but it helps in that case to avoid any of the million ready-to-eat burrito joints in favor of somewhere you actually sit down and order from a menu. A good sign of such a place is guacamole mashed and made tableside: no sleight-of-packaging there. Another good sign of such a place is an external presence elsewhere in the relevant city; reputation matters a bit, insofar as it sets up comparison, expectation, and perhaps a bit of consistency.   And then there's the stiff drink. My flying preference is a margarita: a little salt to help you retain water and avoid dehydration, a little sour to wake up your tired mouth, and a little citrus to freshen your mind. And the only acceptable sign in an airport for one of these is that you're ordering it within the confines of a Mexican restaurant (by which I don't mean Chili's Too).  Barrio Cafe it was: a pretty good choice if you have a bit of time to kill, and similar standards for how to best slay it. While much of the menu is too pricey for an airport terminal (it'll be a cold day in Arizona when I'll pay $22 for an airport meal of anything), there are tacos, tortas, salads, and soups like posole for much cheaper. Plus the tableside guacamole, which looked lovely and which you can slightly customize to your preferences. I went for one of the tortas with avocado, cotija and queso fresco, all spread over a huge split-and-splayed poblano pepper. This isn't a buttery melty torta, but it was nevertheless so big I had to take the face off and eat it with knife and fork. Americanized? Yep, but good, with plenty of nice rolling heat from the poblano in every bite.  And the margarita was perfect. Seriously, that alone is worth a visit even if you're not hungry; it was all I wanted in a little salty, lime-y glass, and was better than many a margarita I've had at Mexican restaurants nowhere near an airport terminal. I only had the basic version, but if you're feeling a little spendier they had several variations that looked quite tempting.  Very friendly service too; I was impressed by how knowledgeable my server (Brianna, I think) was when suggesting wine to other customers. I noticed because, let's face it, wine pairings in an airport aren't usually a top priority, but she was informed, attentive, and patient. And to top it all off, the music in here was Gipsy Kings: a nice change-of-pace and something that added just a touch of perceived sophistication to my meal.  Phoenix SkyHarbor, you're off my misery list. Now let's just get some signage in the airport so people can find Barrio Cafe without having noted the location the night before....

I frequent the airport for business & look forward to eating here as I have not had one bad experience!  There chiliquile's is amazing as well as pork burrito with eggs.  I highly recommend this place to all my family and friends.

Review is based purely on service.  The food is good, not great - some items better than others.  Guacamole is the best thing on their menu in my opinion.  I often eat a late lunch here before I fly out, but each time I'm there the service is a bit slower, the hostess a bit more snippy.  Today was the last time I go here.  Many tables open, but hostess insisted on putting me in back of restaurant next to another table against wall.  When I asked if I could sit elsewhere so I didn't have people up on me, she said they need all the other tables for other people.  Maybe 10 tables open, and you need them all?  I said never mind, I'll eat elsewhere.  I don't do rude well, and rude and ignorant is really not good.  FYI - if you do want to try, the airport location is actually better than the one in the city!

Way overpriced. $19 for a salad, its highway robbery! I do not recommend this based on pricing. NO Airport employee discount either.   There are other vendors with more reasonable pricing within walking distance in the terminal.
Grabbed an glass of wine. The bar stools are comfortable the liquor selection looks ok. The bar is located in the southwest terminal.

Just left! Server took 10 minutes to greet the table. She couldn't even smile. We ordered 2 coronas and waters all around. No waters got delivered. She dropped off the food not even asking if we needed anything else. We ate, the food was good. Christin didn't check back in. At the end I had my card out to pay waiting. Overall she made the experience shitty.

I got sucked in by the idea of pancakes and mimosas, but I have no interested in paying $14 for a mimosa that I'm sure would have a light pour. I opted for coffee, which was sour and see-through but it got the job done.  The pancakes and bacon were actually very tasty, and I received 6 pieces of bacon with it plus fresh and hot maple syrup. I couldn't finish the plate and found it to be pretty tasty. However, $17 for pancakes and coffee is outrageous. I recommend any other place in the airport. In addition to the typical outrageous airport pricing, the service was mediocre. I don't need a bright, beaming ray of sunshine. I just need polite service without mistakes. Asking for a coffee refill seemed to ruin this waiter's day.
Nachos no more...unless they are from the Barrio Cafe! Great spin on the makeover of the nacho plate. Very tasty! Will come back just for that!

Three stars is about right.  This location was not too far from our gate in Terminal 4.  We had a bite to eat here yesterday before our flight home.  Alan had the tacos de camarones w/ water to drink.  I had iced tea and a fruit plate because I wasn't that hungry.  The iced tea was fresh brewed and good.  The fruit plate was OK.  The strawberries were fairly good, the pineapple was very good and the honeydew was hard and tasteless.  The apple slices were too sweet for me, but fine for Alan and the cantaloupe went to him too.  He reported the tacos were fine.  Prices were high, as you would expect in an airport.  Service was very nice.

I had yogurt and fruit for breakfast and there was so much yogurt I had to have a to go box for the fruit.  Janell was the waitress with a personality that was great.  They were very busy but she had time for everyone.
Ordered the chicken enchiladas.   Over cooked chicken in a tortilla with gravy.  They added a side of something unidentifiable.  Yuck!!!

Just had a quick breakfast here. Was hoping for some regular coffee, but it's a French press which was fine but I prefer just a regular cup of coffee. Nothing too fancy. Lol. Mimosas are pricey but nothing out of the ordinary at an airport. I took away two stars because they stop serving breakfast at 10a and we were craving breakfast. However, they still served pancakes and it was delicious just like the server said it would. (: overall cute place to sit down and eat/drink.
Always good food here.....great to get in and out of waiting on a flight. Have never had a bad meal and the service has been really qick

This is an airport bar with all the airport bar amenities. That means $10 draft beers and the oh-so-airport add of a mid-shelf shot for "only" $5. What. A. Deal. On the plus, the bartender was pleasant in the way bartenders are pleasant when they know beyond the shadow of a doubt there is a 0% chance you're a regular. Also, it's there. And it's the only place in that gate where you can get a drink. Beggars can't be choosers. Tip well and enjoy your nap on the plane.

If you've ever dined at one of Chef Silvana's creations and are expecting the same experience here, keep walking. To be fair, I do not believe Chef is associated with this place other than the naming royalties.  The service is hurried and the efficient wait staff are obviously anxious to flip tables. "No, I'm not finished with my guacamole" as we stare at a half dozen chips and a fair amount of guac. It is an airport eatery after all. The food is better than most Mexican themed airport restaurants but as stated before, it ain't THE Barrio Cafè.

Ordered a cocktail & asked to change tv channel from basketball game not one person was watching. Manager said they'd "look into it." 20 minutes later still no change. Server asks if I want another. If you change channel, sure. No change! Now more ppl asking to change channel to oscars. Servers were nice but "manager behind the curtain denied request." So weird.

We were at the airport and hungry!!! We were in Terminal D so stopped in here to watch the Astros play the Yankees.  We were seated promptly. The tables are pretty small which makes sense as you want more people in an area, but with everyone hauling their carry on luggage it can get fun trying to walk in the aisles. Be careful folks.  Each table had a device where you can press one of three buttons to get your waiter's attention, get the check and there was another button I can't remember what it was for. The server wore a wristband that would notify them of the table calling for service. Pretty cool since this place gets busy being at the airport.  We ordered the guacamole Barrio ($12.35). The menu states it is prepared table side. Our guacamole came out in a bowl already prepared. The server had cilantro all over the plates she handed us. The guacamole was good, but needed some salt. Definitely had a spicy kick to it that I appreciated. The salsa that was brought out was very tasty too! The tortilla chips were thick so it was easy to scoop up the guacamole.  The Michelada with Dos XX (asked for it extra spicy) was not bad at all. The server recommended that over the Bloody Maria. Good choice.  Overall, the place is good and of course any time you buy ANYTHING at an airport it will be at a higher price than other places outside the airport. The food wasn't bad at all.  Good place to hang out at and watch the game. Must check out the murals in here. Pretty cool.

Was surprised how good this place was, and at the airport in Terminal D no less.    A bit pricey mind you but it is the airport after all.     Food was really good.   I had the Arizona Burrito and probably the freshest burrito I've had in a long time.   Great mix of ingredients.   Now let's talk service.   You know by my other reviews, service can make or break a place.   Well, the service here was phenomenal.  Our waitress Alexandra was superb.   Great to find a good waitress and we tipped accordingly.   Also, I must comment on the management to, as they were actively  present and engaged with the staff and customers.   Really nice to see leadership in action.    Try this place.   Well worth it.

Dammit I was in the mood for their "famous carne asada fries" first of all, dogs eat better. The meat tasted rubbery and chewy. The fries were soggy. Very pricey but it is in the Airport. However how can you label something the special when it taste like yesterday's garbage. I had to get tums to relive the pain of gas and upset stomach. Will not be going back.

Great experience until Terry came over yelling at me and my party, accusing us of smuggling wine out, but we were still at the table. I was like we don't have to sneak wine. We can buy more in the plane. Lol.

Once I clicked on this restaurant, I was hoping, from seeing the low reviews, I clicked the wrong location.  No, this is the correct spot, the one in the airport, and I actually had decent service and good food.  (I ate here around January 2013).    What I had: *cochinita pibil-  meat was flavorful and tender, and large portions.  The sides it came with complimented the meat. *guac- what a nice, surprising twist adding pomegranate seeds to guac.  Nice how you can add items to the guac (like onions, cilantro, tomatoes, etc) and it is made fresh to order at the table.  I thought this place is the best airport food I have had.  No complaints yet!  I hope to return during my next trip to AZ.

Very expensive  Customer comes 1st , NOT HERE  Upset if you don't order a 12 appetizer  Nothing on menu is below 12 $ You are trapped at D gates for a drink or something to eat ! That's the main reason why they are in business still.

On a layover between flights, we decided to have Breakfast at this location basically because it was next to the gate. I ordered the Arizona burrito ($13) and it was delicious . Also enjoyed some delicious Fresh orange juice.  Service was fast and the restaurant clean. Btw the restrooms are just outside the restaurant entrance. If you have time between flights, this is a good place to grab a meal. Only complaint...not exclusive to this restaurant....why do you seat customers on top of each other when the restaurant is about 20% full? When we were initially being seated, the hostess proceeded to take us to a table right next to another couple, a two top right next to them.  We asked if we could have a another table so that we would give them and us  privacy considering the restaurant was not full.   Then the hostess proceeded to seat a gentleman right next to us, literally an arms length away...when there was clearly 10 to 20 tables she could've been seated him at... So, we got to listen to him talk on the cell phone while we ate breakfast and he got to listen to us talk...Just asking for some commonsense and thoughtfulness please.

Food is good!  I got the nachos which were great and a Bloody Mary which was made with tequila (and was great!)  A little pricey but large portion so not dinging their score.   If you have time to kill at the airport visit this place

The people behind the bar were polite. The hostess was rude. Lady I don't want a burrito with cheese I'm allergic. It's 6AM and there is 6 customers here. How hard is it to make a burrito without cheese lol. The people behind the bar had great service and realized how easy it is to make a burrito without cheese lol. The hostess maybe "Andrea" couldn't grasp the concept.

Of course I was looking at distance from my gate, and chose Barrio Cafe. I love Mexican food and was hoping this would be a good choice in D gates.  The host is very friendly and cordial.  I ordered Tacos de Pollo Poblano with a side salad.  The tacos looked like vomit topped with goat cheese. Less than pleasing. And, if I had known the 'soft' corn tortillas would come basically raw and plenty hard, I would have had airplane peanuts for lunch.  The saving grace was the side salad. Great flavors.  Was it worth the $15 price tag? No. Next time, I'll walk down to A gates and eat at Blanco's Tacos & Tequila.
The 2 scariest food words for me? "Airport food". (actually "goat cheese" but play along). this palce is legit, though. and very reaonably priced for an airport place. try the chili verde burrito.
I was served water with a bug in it, and after bringing it to the attention of the manager, they still did not offer to comp my breakfast. I will not be back.

Don't expect good or friendly service. They seem very put out by your very existence in their restaurant/bar.   I had a hard time getting service let alone paying my bill to try to get to my plane on time.   They do have a good tequila selection if that's your thing. Which is mine. I would've gladly spent more money on tequila if they'd have bothered to check in with me.

a bit upscaley,   but the chef certainly made me a fan..  although i wont expect this to happen again... i was looking for " regulalr joe" mexican food... not taco bell exactly,  but at least ground beef on something...   the chef created , for my benefit   "regular joe"  mexican food  for me... so i was happy.   i need more of a regio's  on indian school rd or caroline's mexican food on 16th.  but sa la vie!   the cafe had great seating  and excellent customer service.
Fair food and over priced. For them just getting named one of the top Mexican restaurants in the country disappoints.

This is a pleasant surprise for airport food.  This is real food, a bit pricey but it's in an airport.  It's a lively place with colorful artwork on the walls and bright overstuffed banquettes along the walls.  There's a busy bar area too.  We didn't have much time so we ordered quick and asked for rush on the food and they accommodated us without complaint.  I had the cochinta pibil torta which was very tasty, orange scented slow cooked pork, pickled red onion, Mexican cheese, beans, pico de gallo, guacamole on crusty bread.  Yummy.  My son had the steak Ricardo - a perfectly cooked steak served with a bunch of Mexican accoutrements over fries.  Also very tasty.  This is a nice choice if you've got some time at Sky Harbor.
Ok for airport food. There was only a partial menu so no basics. But it was ok. The problem is at this airport there are some great food choices so that makes this 3 stars.

Solid airport option - lunch on a Friday in terminal 4, by D gates. Went for the house pork tacos w fries- filling food! Good stuff, esp for an airport. Service was a bit slow but very friendly staff and great music- soak it up for a while!
Waited to be seated for 7 mins. I then sat myself down since the staff was busy watching the soccer game on tv. Waitress then got mad at me. I left. Rude people

Traveling out of Phoenix?   Barrio Cafe is a must stop if you're departing from the D gates. And if you're not, it's worth the hike if your time permits.   I adore their location(s) in the Valley and the airport is no exception.   Although will admit - I haven't indulged in much of the menu here (a lot of complaints noted and the quality of service) beyond their chips and salsa ($9) which seem true to form.   Just the right amount of spice and flavor in it to make the locals happy, but not enough to scare off the Snowbirds and "Aliens from Minnesota".   Order these with the infamous Low Rider Margarita ($14.25). With a generous pour of Don Julio Silver, surely you'll be feeling like you're walking on air before your flight.   Heading out to Puerto Rico this morning, hubs Andrew C. helped himself to one. Me? Well, tequila and I aren't the best of friends at 40,000 feet so ordered a Double Screwdriver ($12) with their fresh squeezed daily orange juice. Perfect.   Friendly and efficient service which was a pleasant surprise  (this is a holiday travel weekend at the time of review).   Sit at the bar and say hello to Ken and Terry.   Enjoy your flight!

As I sit here at the barrio cafe I must say I'm really disappointed. The staff rushed me into a decision and didn't really answer some of the questions I had about the menu. The food is way over priced. I got the roasted pork plate because when I asked any questions about anything else the server just told me it was the best (its also the priciest of the options I was looking at).  I originally wanted wine, but they were out of about half the options and I wasn't about to pay $15 for a glass of Mexican merlot.... My $12 blended margarita was semi runny but also hard to consume due to chunks of ice in it... I mean come on if you're going to over charge me at least give me something decent.  My meal arrived about 120 seconds after I ordered it... I think I just paid $40 for fast food (that zucchini could not have possibly been cooked fresh...)  Since I have been sitting here I have noticed rude staff (not necessarily to me but to others around me!) one of the gimmicks of this place I guess is that they make guac table side.... I straight up saw the host and a server get into an argument while the server was making the guac for a table next to me.  No one smiles. No one accommodates. And my corn tortillas stuck together and ripped apart :( :( :( very sad I wasted my money here.

This place was pretty cool and it was my first time there...surprisingly at the airport location rather than down the street at the actual location. The bartenders were nice. We had some great drinks and the food looked amazing. I would love to check out the actual location but the Phoenix airport is pretty awesome now that it has all the local restaurants in there.

This review is for breakfast only.  Had a breakfast burrito with chicken. It simply tasted terrible. I can't say it was the recipe or food itself or maybe it just wasn't my thing but it was terrible none the less. Coffee was extremely bitter and topped off the expensive lesson. It's the airport so maybe I should just accept that it will be sub par.

Airport food has a much earned reputation.  I have to say, I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food, drink and service here.   Yes, sticker shock at looking at the menu (and the resulting tab). I had a margarita and it was served in a tall glass. I have to admit I was expecting more juice than Tequila - what a surprise!  I could taste the tequila in a well balanced margarita. They did well by my husbands gin martini too.   I ordered the pork tacos and my husband had the chicken tacos. Yes. They were spicy. If you like heat - they were delicious!  The pork was their special slow roasted pork and very tasty. The chicken tacos had a delicious cream sauce. We chose the house salad.  The salad was made from salad greens and topped with onions, tomatoes and crumble cheese. The salad was lightly dressed with balsamic vinaigrette. Presentation was excellent.   All in all, almost worth the price - 4 stars for great food - minus one star for pricing.
Must try the guacamole...and their pulled pork dishes are phenomenal!! I have yet to eat anything bad from here. Very authentic and very good. They make the guacamole fresh right in front of you.

This is a nice option with tasty alternatives to your traditional airport food but it is overpriced and service was slow. $16.50 got me half of an avocado on a small bed of greens with 4 small shrimp. Plus the menu said it was $15. It was tasty and a nice light meal for traveling. Service was slow which normally isn't a good thing for travel but we had 4 hours to kill. I had to ask for dressing twice, my husband got the wrong side, and we asked for something we never ended up receiving. If you have a few extra bucks in your travel budget and time for a sit down meal, this is a good option.
Tries too hard. Bad service especially when even slightly crowded. Plating of food is like throwing random stuff on plates. Rude servers. Food not great.

As I wandered around the airport trying to find a seat to watch the US v Belgium game, I finally stumbled across the Barrio Cafe. I was so happy to be seated at a bar and watching the game that they could have served dogfood and I would have been OK. Rest assured they did not serve dogfood. This wasn't as salty. I am kidding of course but the food was not memorable. Ordered the Torta Cochinita Pibil. It was a big sandwich of pork marinated in achiote and sour orange. That sounds great but it was rather bland. It was topped with pickled onion and pico de gallo. Those were nice but the strong flavor of the torta bread overpowered. The fries were decent and I enjoyed the spicy chipotle ketchup. Ultimately, the pork was underwhelming and a torta cannot recover if the star fails.
NOT your standard airport restaurant fare!  Try the chicken poblano enchilada.  Service was friendly and attentive.

Since I'm going to New Orleans and probably won't eat any Mexican food, figured I need to have something before I take off.   This place is Term D and well decorated. I rally like the theme and paintings.   Service-very slow moving, everyone around me had to ask several times to drinks, check, or other. Maybe more staff.....  Food-opted for Posole Verde because I was looking for something not so heavy and warm. This hit hit the spot, prefer when you get to add the sides, but this place served them already mixed in.   Couple notes on prices:  Chips & Salsa-$9 Chips & Guac-$16( if not more)   Over priced in my opinion, but I'm sure airport space isn't cheap.
The burrito is full of chicken but that is where it ends. there is minimal flavor and the food is overpriced, what do you expect in an airport. On a positive note the service was decent.

Good for drinks but not much else... Margaritas "blended" were an icy/watery mess and the table side made guacamole featured full leaves of cilantro and chunks of jalapeño - could use a smaller chop there. Just grab drinks at the bar and you'll be fine.
If you're ever at the airport stop in and try it ALL!!! Just as awesome as the actual restaurant. We live in California and go to Arizona just to eat at the restaurants!
Been twice, good service.  Food is ok, not great not bad.  Has four peaks peach on tap so I'll be back.  Standard airport pricing.

The best part of this place was the beer. Guess it's hard to mess up pulling a tap handle.  The beer was slightly overpriced but still ok for an airport.  We ordered the "table side" guacamole.  Not made table side which I didn't care but don't advertise that on the menu.  The chips were so hard they were almost not edible.   Probably the worst part of this place was the service.  From the time the hostess sat us we felt like the server didn't want us to be there.  $35 for two beers subpar guac and horrible service not even worth it at an airport.  There is a cafe next door that is the better option.

I'm giving this a 3 star only because of the price and quality of the food. To their credit, the place is clean, appears to run pretty efficiently, and the staff is polite and prompt. But $13 for that little margarita? I dunno. I ordered the Nachos as an "appetizer but could I have it as a meal, please? yes, with chicken" but I had to dig around for the little pieces of chicken it came with. Fortunately, I'm not much of a meat eater so it made little difference to me. But, for $17, when I want chicken, I want more that 2 oz. scattered in little pieces throughout.   The sidebar guac looked entertaining although we did not partake. There's also televisions so you can watch the latest game before catching your flight. However, the way overpriced food and lack of substance is what brought this review down.
Pork tacos are flavourful and horrible at the same time. The consistency of the tortilla is almost like stale bread. The meat and other dressings have good flavor though.

Surprisingly good eatery for an airport.  The place was packed and servers running about madly attending to hungry flyers.  My server eyed me from across the bar, reading my impatience and immediately came over.  I had the carnitas torta (Mexican sandwich on a hard roll). with fries.  The pork was tender, super juicy, and bursting with flavor.  The bun was good but could have been a bit crunchier.  Fries were fresh and tasty, accompanied by spicy ketchup.  The Cadillac margarita was excellent.  Take this out of the airport and it would be a winner.  All in all, a good experience.

This might be crazy but anytime I take southwest and I have to have a layover I always make it in phx. Why because of this place here. BEST UNTRADITIONAL NACHOS EVER! Scale of 1-10 these nachos are a 20 ! I eat a whole order to myself every time! A little pricy but I honestly don't care worth every penny and the layover I just wish we had them out here in Seattle ! Can't wait till my next layover lol

What a treat during my layover in Pheonix! As I walked by, I smelled deliciousness, so I couldn't pass up an opportunity to try Barrio Cafe. I got the steak tacos upon suggestion and I was not disappointed! Flavorful marinated steak with large chunks of avocado on corn tortillas. AMAZING. The side salad that comes with it was great as well.   Hope I get 'layovered' in Pheonix again in the future so that I can try their Arizona Burrito, green chili pork, and shrimp tacos!
Most disappointing breakfast burrito I've had in my life. Bland and obviously just thrown together. Cost over $10. Lady was nice.

There was an Instagram photo of their Phoenix sign located at their parking lot. Since we only had three hours in Phoenix that we decided to eat lunch at Barrio Cafe.   There was a homeless guy in a wheelchair waiting outside and when I went inside one of the server came out and gave him a gallon of water. That was really nice to see as it was really hot outside.   We were greeted and seated immediately. The staff were really friendly.   The place is very artsy and there were art works from Pablo Luna. You can buy some of his artworks as there were prices.   We were really hungry and the food we ate definitely hit the spot! We live in San Francisco and usually prefer eating authentic Mexican foods in the Mission district. It was really good and reminded me of the tacos I ate when I was in Tijuana.   Overall, I recommend this place and would love to visit again once I come back to Phoenix.

Plenty of outlets for travelers that are in need of some power- both at the bar and in the booths. Extremely fast service and food delivery (a plus for quick layovers) - but they're not quick to make you leave if you've got time to kill, either. I ordered the chicken tacos (tacos come in corn tortilla- burritos are larger in a flour tortilla) - seriously delicious. Keep in mind I'm a goat cheese fanatic - so that played into this crazy happy review.  I will definitely make this a regular stop for upcoming PHX layovers!

For an airport restaurant this place is decent. I got tacos and nachos. I can't even describe the nachos. They looked like a plate with chips and every ingredient you can think of thrown on top of them. Very bland, and the sauce was gross, runny, and tasteless too.  The tacos, however, were really good- fried shrimp. Hit the spot.  Also had a couple margaritas which tasted mostly like margarita mix. Basically the tacos were this places saving grace. If you're craving tacos before you leave or your flight is delayed I would get yours here.

I was referred here after being told the restaurants in the Phoenix airport were great. Our experience at this restaurant was not great. The server, Jane,  was fantastic - completely on top of it, and had our order and ticket out quickly as she knew we were in a hurry. But the food was just not good. I chose the special, the Burrito Arizona, which arrived an uninspired lump which tasted like salty pot roast. Nothing special about that. The side salad (I thought it was odd to have a choice of side salad or fries with a burrito, but i went with it) was just old. The leaves were wilted and starting to scum over, and no amount of dressing could hide that. And while the guacamole itself was good, the chips served with it were stale.   We ended up downing our beers and picking at the food. I might have complained had I had more time, but alas, we had a plane to catch.   Good thing Southwest gave me extra snacks once on board.

They would have gotten at least 4 stars, but when I asked for a tea to go the great server told me she couldn't do that. However, she was happy to up sell me a bottle of water.   Service was also at first to be seated and then to have an actual server stop by the table. It was a busy time as loads of flights had been delayed and they were working to close up shop around 9pm.   Once I got a server...everything was great. Table side guacamole was good as were the pork tacos.   I would stop by again if I was on a delayed flight in terminal 4.

Ok we all know airport food is overpriced.   Got it. We aren't judging based on that since your totally at the mercy of whatever they are charging unless you would rather starve waiting for your insanely delayed flight. After waking around for 45 minutes and realizing this was the only open restaurant we thought we were settling. Boy were we wrong! The only thing better than the food was the service. So friendly and welcoming. Great margaritas and incredible Mexican food. This place was a much needed oasis in a desert of airport hell.

The kitchen took shortcuts with our $13 Arizona burritos. They left out the crema mexicana and the Oaxaca cheese. Our 2 burritos only had the pork green chile in a tortilla. Shame on the kitchen for taking advantage of airport customers. If the Barrio cafe had a little more pride, this place could be delicious.   The server did bring us some crema Mexicana & Oaxaca cheese when we complained, but naturally the cheese wasn't melted. We tossed the cold cheese into our burritos.   My fries were decent for airport fries, and came with a spicy ketchup which I enjoyed. Our server was cheerful.   The cafe is in the D terminal and is convenient when flying Southwest. Ask for a table with outlets and you can charge your smart phone for more yelping! Or just eat somewhere better. )-; 0-;
Worst bloody marys in the airport. Pass on by.
Having breakfast before we head home. Ordered the Americano which was really good. The bacon has a little kick to it.  Sausage looks tasty too. Had reg coffee and lots of it.

I don't quite understand the mediocre rating but I have only eaten here once.  I had poblano chicken soft tacos. They were incredibly flavorful. The spices were very unique and not your standard "american" Mexican flavors. In fact, save for a restaurant in San Diego, this has probably been the best tasting Mexican food that I have had in a very long time (I am from the Midwest).  The cost was what you would expect for an airport. The service was fast and knowledgeable, but it was at a slow time. Enjoy!
Best nachos I've ever had. Hands down. If you are fortunate enough to be in this terminal of PHX...do it.
Margaritas are great but BEWARE, they will charge you $9 for chips and salsa. It's not on the menu and the server didn't mention the extra cost.
Don't do it!!! The worst food ever. I ordered the breakfast burrito and it made me sick. I wish I wouldn't have eaten any of it - esp before flying! Lesson learned.

Except for getting my food order wrong and my drink order wrong, the food was good. I had the pork torta and it was well balanced with a decent roll.  But, can't give more stars with the inattentive server.
The food here was surprisingly delicious!  Very classy place with a unique twist on the dishes I tried. I'm in from out of town on business, busy will be returning when I come back for sure!

I was stuck in the airport after a delay with Southwest Airlines.  Had some time to kill and was a little hungry.  The place looked bright and clean.  I was seated immediately by a nice greeter.  Placed an order for chicken tacos and checked Yelp reviews as I waited for my food.  Got a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews.....several about the chicken tacos!  Before I could even finish reading reviews, my food was out.  3 smallish tacos. Soft fresh tortillas with piping hot chicken.  The cream sauce was delicious.  The salad was nice and cold.  Mixed greens with balsamic vinaigrette.  My server Vincent was friendly, polite and efficient. Absolutely worth every penny of the $14!   I'm glad I read the reviews AFTER I ordered or I might have missed out on this place.

Wow! What a pleasant surprise. Great service with call buttons to order or get check quickly. Food was very good, and with unique dishes to choose from, there is terrific variety. Margarita was yummy!! And not overpriced for airport. A great place to relax before your flight.
Best place to eat in the airport.  Fish tacos are fresh and it's a nice change from airport food :) I'll be back.

Very pleased overall with the food and service.  I had the bacon and thick cut bacon and it was delicious!  The coffee is definitely a must have and was impressed with their attention to including the splenda at the beginning to ensure it was well dissolved. Overall a great quick stop for breakfast and I would highly recommend the coffee!

I guess its not bad for an airport resturant.  The service was so bad.. it took us 10 mins each time to flag down the waitress.  We got shrimp tacos that were pretty good except it only had 1 shrimp in each of them... I'd head over to gate A&B to eat at Four Peaks instead

If you are starving between flights and only have time to grab from their to-go cooler, don't bother stopping.  No one working the stand and the bartender refused to ring me up.  To the male bartender who was unnecessarily rude--acting like something is not part of your job is never the right response to a customer.  If you don't like being a restaurant employee, that's on you and it's no one else's problem.  Please don't take it out on the people who want to spend money at your establishment.

I had a good salad chicken salad with tomatoes over a bed of spinach. The service was very slow in the beginning - I couldn't find waitstaff anywhere to order. Eventually she showed up and was quite attentive.
Surprisingly delicious! We had a goody-packed chicken salad, burrito, & tacos. Everything was of quality, flavorful, & delicious. Service was crazy fast & attentive. Prices were great. Portions nice.

- The service was friendly and prompt - The guacamole was better than what I had at the downtown location - The posole was much worse than the downtown location  Overall, decent overpriced airport food if you have time.

Airport chow , ordered fish tacos with fries also came with a small salad plus 3 caronas. About 35 bucks. Tasty, great grilled  fish tacos with cabbage and avocado..would have been better but the tortillas just were not as warm as they should have been ..it was slightly above average for airport chow...i would still  recommend trying this dish

I arrived very early to pick up my daughters, so I went in for a beer.  I had a Negra Modelo, and after a bit, felt hungry.  Their prices are a bit extreme for just a snack, but the fresh-made guacamole sounded delicious, and was reasonably priced.  They prepare it table-side, and the anticipation of watching it being prepared makes it taste better. (True story)  It had large chunks of avocado, jalapenos, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, lemon juice, and is topped with pomegranate seeds.  One of the most amazing guacamoles I've ever had, and I have had, and made dozens of recipes.  I may have to head to the location outside the airport, and try one of their entrees.  If I spend any significant amount of time in the airport again, I'll certainly hit this spot again!
Not bad for airport food.  Really enjoyed my torta.  Beer taps weren't working when I was there, so that was a bummer.

OK. At least get the food prep right!  While waiting for a Southwest flight (like everybody else here), I ordered the "Arizona Burrito" which was on the small size and not adequately heated. This came with either fries or a small salad. I opted for the salad, which was made with mixed greens and chopped tomatoes. The salad was just OK - a little heavy on the dressing. But the biggest problem was that the Arizona Burrito didn't come with any cheese or crema. These were clearly on the burrito's description on the menu! No Oaxaca cheese or crema Mexicana at all. The waitress was nice and brought out some cheese and crema on the side, but it just wasn't the same! Any other restaurant would have had the manager come to the table.   Another big problem has to do with the general atmosphere at this Barrio Cafe. It felt like the workers and waitstaff were not too serious about their jobs. They were pretty casual about everything - too much goofing off. This is clearly a problem with management.   I won't be dining at the Barrio Cafe in the future. My food was just OK, made incorrectly, and way overpriced for what you got.

That was the best Mexican food I've ever had, and that includes travel to Mexico.  We were in a hurry; our fight was boarding in 15 minutes. Rox got us our food within five minutes, and steak tacos coupled with a Goose Island IPA are a great way to start my trip.  Sure, it was pricier than I expected, but it was double the food at 120% the price.   Worth it.   I'll be back.

Close to the gates, with plenty of seating and outlets for laptops. We wanted a drink while waiting to board. The waitress was clueless as to the pricing and offerings. It's a tequila bar and I had to ask for the tequila menu. Then when I order a flight, she asked if I wanted it doubled - I asked how much to double the flight - she didn't know. Came back and said $15 to double and I ask, each shot or for the flight?  She was confused. Then realized I ordered a flight and acted like I was the person in the wrong. Weird.   $27 for a flight of good tequila in an airport. Not bad. We had a quiet corner, Mexican coke, and pressed coffee too.   Can't comment on the food but be patient and CLEAR with the waitstaff. You might get the same one.

I will start out by saying this was one of the best meals I have had this year.     I stopped by around 11:30am after running some errands in the area.  I opted for the bar as the ambience was very cool and they had a great selection of tequilas (passes on the tequila this time around, but it was enjoyable to scan everything they have).     I was greeted promptly and also served some complementary bread and tapenade.  I'll admit I have never had this combo before at a Mexican spot, but it was very good.     After looking the at the fantastic menu, I went with the seafood enchiladas.  They came out within 15 minutes.  3 good sized enchiladas with nice portions of crab, shrimp, and small scallops!   The flavors and textures were phenomenal.  There was a mild cheese along with goat cheese inside of the enchiladas - didn't make the dish heavy at all and the goat cheese added a nice tang.  It was also served with a side of veggies which paired great with the cheesy main dish.    Everything was pretty much perfect with regards to this experience.  If you decide to go with this dish, make sure you like goat cheese.  They put a good amount of it in the enchiladas.     Can't wait to head back to try another dish soon!
Not bad for airport. The AZ style burrito was not nearly as impressive as the description. Not terrible just disappointing. Did not try the margaritas.

Some of the best food ever served in an airport.  The enchiladas, which are tightly rolled in crusty tortillas and are consequently more like flautas, are outstandingly creative and delicious.  The rest of the fairly small menu is also up to snuff.  The only catch is, the service, especially the taking of orders and, even more, the bringing of the check, are on the leisurely scale of a sitdown city restaurant, not of an airport.  If you have less than about 100 minutes till your flight, then FORGET IT.  Don't eat here: you'll expire of a heart attack while fretting over whether the bill will come before your plane starts boarding.  But the food is good enough to make it worth arranging a long layover, or coming here from another pod in the same terminal, at least.
Subpar food and service. Surprising for an airport. At least they usually have quick service. Go somewhere else for a meal here.

I had dinner here once before earlier this year and found the food good...not great...good, in reading the menu I thought that I was In for a real treat....mom and pop restaurant does good with great food.  This time around not so good....I was hungry and Taco,s sounded great, one of the offerings that looked great were chicken tacos covered in a cilantro lime sauce and cheese....YUMMY!!! Not so much, the waitress was sweet and friendly, but the Tacos were tough and chewy...pre made, seemed frozen and reheated.....reheated to the point that the cheese was glued to the plate, chicken dense and thick, and the tortilla shells would crack your teeth if you had ok dental hygiene. The crema and sauce were yummy....not enough to save the dish...  After eating the edible portions that would not crack my teeth, I asked for the check and showed the waitress how tough the tacos were by smacking them with my fork, I asked her to do the same and she did and agreed, I asked her to tell the chefs not to overcook them for other customers.  She returned with my check and stated "I told them" with a worried look, and nothing else....I tipped her well as she deserved, and I left...I guess what I have to rationalize is...."well....it is only airport food"

This place is amazing...and it's in the airport! I stopped to wait for a delayed flight...thought is have some chips and salsa with a beer. First of all, they have an incredible selection of margaritas on the menu so I ordered one. Fantastic choice. The I caved in and ordered Cochinita Pibil. It's a pork roast that is seasoned, paired with chiles and sour oranges and then wrapped in banana leaves and roasted slow overnight. You cannot imagine.   It was plated with squash, some mashed potato and several corn tortillas. Boom. You're done. An amazing dish, full of flavor and so tender. Delicious. With the margarita it was perfection!

Don't do it! The drinks are strong, that's my only compliment. I was on a 3 hour delay and decided to opt for a table to nosh while I waited.... I ordered the table side guacamole for $12, so I guess since I was sitting alone I didn't rate the table side service. My server brought a bowl with the ingredients piled in it and proceeded to smash it all together with a spoon. There was so little avocado in the bowl that even after mixing and smashing it all together it still didn't look Iike guac.  So I ordered the shrimp tacos for $14, they were street taco size and I was surprised to see 1 fried shrimp in each taco, that's it! I understand they are small, but come on, I expected at least 2 shrimp per taco! To add insult to injury, each street taco had a huge slice of fat avocado on it.... Guess I know why my guac was so stingy... They save it for the tacos! Not my favorite, even though it's the airport, there are other choices....

I walked in as a skeptic with an attitude, and bartender Kenneth totally crushed it with kindness, and food of course!  I wanted to stick to protein as much as able. No need for papas and pan. Kenneth took care of my hangry-ness with three eggs over medium and chorizo. Fantastic.  I ponder why no egg chorizo and queso creation on the breakfast menu, other than a green chili item. Just sayin'.

High prices for food and drink. If you have to have Mexican food then be ready to pay up.  3 tacos for $14/$16 1 tequila based drink $11-$14 No chips while you wait.  One good thing about this place, they have free water.
Overpriced greasy food,  not to mention rude staff and waitress. When appetizer was presented she threw plate at our direction and walked off. The bloody Mary was good but I will not come back.

Fast service and good food.  I enjoyed coffee and a bfast sandwich.  It came with REAL chorizo.  Probably not the wisest thing to eat before a flight but it was tasty.  A bit messy though.  The atmosphere was as nice as a general airport restaurant can be.

Man, Barrio Cafe has a very hard time trying to replicate it's original location. I had some extra time at the airport due to a weather issue and decided to charge my iphone for the tenth time at Barrio Cafe. I have given Barrio Queen a chance even though the reviews were iffy at best and found out that Barrio Cafe at the airport could be even further from the original.   Staff sucked: now this may be because it's tough to get people to work at the airport so I will let that slide.   Food: Honest to God, I wouldn't serve this to my dog. I ordered the Tacos De Arrachera (Skirt Steak) and I am not kidding when I say this cow must have either been 70 yrs old or the chef has never grilled a skirt steak in his/her life. Unchewable and absolutely flavorless!   My girlfriend and I are always debating over the Original Barrio Cafe as to whether or not it really is that good. I think one thing they are good at is ambiance. Cool Urban Mexican Art can't make up for a shit show in this kitchen.

Airport restaurants are pricey. This was no exception.  The Pollo Pablano burrito was delicious as was the Borracho Quesadilla.  The service is terrible. We waited far too long at an airport terminal. The drinks were very overpriced and our server didn't know the difference between the margarita and the Paloma.  We asked 4 time for our check.  The only reason our server got a decent tip was we didn't have time to wait for change.

A bit of sticker shock when we sat down, but it was pretty good by Mex restaurant standards, with some interesting items you wouldn't see on most menus. Really good by airport standards, we were 4 for 4 on entrees we'd order again. Can't give it 5*, the price/value/food ratio is a little off, but I would (and will) repeat.

You expect horrible, overpriced food and awful service at any airport restaurant. Here, the food and service is great and the airport premium modest. They were able to do 3 tacos no dairy and Chris is a great server. Selfish, rude, entitled Yelpers ... Seriously. With a long wait between flights you could do far far worse.

Wow, hard finding a quiet, reasonably priced restaurant in an airport so thought we got to a good one.  However, the customer sitting next to us just found a napkin with writing on it in her SALAD!!! And the staff didn't even offer a FREE meal!! Yikes! My fish taco was just okay but I'll avoid this place in the future.

I've had a lot of airport food, most of it sucks and lower your expectations. This place is excellent. Arizona burrito with fries was delicious, soft pork with just enough sauce to make your mouth water. Be warned the catsup is spicy, a nice kick of hot sweet and salty fries to balance the all meat burrito.   Will come back again

This location is in Terminal 4 next to the D-1. The Bloody Mary's are spicy and delicious. I've had their pozole and today the free chile chilaquillas with over medium eggs. Amazing. Spice is just right - if you are flying out of here - allow extra time and you won't be let down. By the way - waitress Victoria was super sweet and concerned about your time - so super speedy and prompt!!

"Oh, look," I say, "They have a 'to-go' counter."  But not an expedient one.  You order off of the menu and then they make your food, and if you're me, then they make the wrong thing and have to make it again.  So twenty minutes later, you can go catch up with your friends and actually board your plane.  They did give me the botch, though, which was a nice bonus.  Food was a little bland and not quite as delicious as I'd been hoping for.  I also found the breakfast sandwich a little difficult to eat while I was sitting on the plane, worrying that I wouldn't be able to bite into the giant bread without squirting over-easy egg onto everything surrounding me.    Sadly, it's about the only restaurant in this terminal, though it looks as though they might be building another one.

Service issues ! Usually come here when I travel to AZ because the Mexican food is different and well prepared. This guy Pedro is so annoying and lazy. The place got pretty busy right after we arrived for breakfast . The young lady was seating people, taking orders, cleaning tables. She called out for help in both English and Spanish. He kept putting her off and never really made himself useful. Irritating! Addendum: food quality deteriorated. Not coming back

Currently sitting here. The food is pretty good. Typical airport prices. The customer service sucks. I kept having to ask for a refill all the while my cup being visually empty and within eyesight and we were only 15 mins into just being here not even received our food yet(I just happened to be thirsty). Only some of us had silverware and no napkins. A customer from another table tried to ask a waitress for something and before the server gave her any attention the server said "yeah, I'll be right with you" the server walked behind me and said "Jesus" rolled her eyes and kept walking. Pretty unprofessional to say those things within earshot of other customers. It makes me think that even though I'm paying not only for my food but for their service and what I have to say is not important and that I, as a customer am not important enough to be heard.

Sunday May 21, 2017 7:30 pm 3 of us had 2 hours before our flight and had Barrio Café for dinner. We ordered tableside guac & chips, Ensalada Mata (shrimp cabbage salad) and a margarita. Food was EXCEPTIONAL. Pricey but well worth every penny. As others have said, their margaritas are terrible. Hard to figure how they can make a margarita so bitter and yucky. Maybe "fresh" lime juice isn't so fresh. Food was very very good and I will definitely seek out Barrio Café & try other menu items next time. TIPS: 1. Have 2 hours and take your time. It's not for someone in a hurry. 2. Ask for extra cilantro in your guacamole. 3. The shrimp is so GOOD and TASTY, ask to pay for extra shrimp. 4. Lastly, ask to taste the margarita mix BEFORE ordering or get beer.
I understand we are at the airport but this place is awful. Yuck. Although the one in gilbert is okay.
3 hours to kill waiting on my flight. Thank God for Barrio.....food is excellent and the staff are wonderful. One of the best restaurants in Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport!!!

No bueno for the Barrio Cafe.  The table side guac would have been good had the cold, dripping with oil chips, not also been stale and thick enough to crack a tooth.   Decided to abandon the guac and try more punishment and give their street tacos a try-meh.   Service-The server was indifferent.

This is the best restaurant at the Phoenix airport. I've been here many times for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and had a pleasant experience every time. The staff is very friendly and the food exceeds your expectations of airport food.   The burritos are a great option for breakfast or dinner (I've had them all). I think my favorite thing here is the Mexican Café. It's a rich full bodied coffee with complex flavors served to you fresh in a French press. I've emptied it every time I've had it! I get it even if I'm flying home at 11p. I risk being up all night just to enjoy the great café!  If you're at the Phoenix airport on a long layover or just want a bite to eat, go to Barrio Cafe! Make sure you get the coffee!  They also have a large selection of Mexican tequila. I'm always in Phoenix for work, so I've never had any of their tequila samplers myself...

I spend a lot of time in Phoenix Sky Harbor and in airport restaurants in general. The most important aspect to airport restaurants is that you have to provide prompt service, as your customers have a hard and fast deadline (e.g., plane boarding). For the fourth time in a row, I've had to essentially beg someone to serve me here, and then, after finally getting served, I have to beg them to bring me my bill. The push-button service call buttons must not be connected, as they don't seem to bring the servers to my table any quicker.   HMS Host, you do it right at all the other great restaurants in Terminal 4, including LGO, Zinc, and Humble Pie. I've never had an issue with any of those places. Why can't you figure out how to make Barrio Cafe work correctly?   Yes, the food is good -- once it finally arrives. Too bad I have to wolf it down to catch my flight.
Not bad for an airport restaurant. A little loud whether from the airport ambience or the music played. The food is pretty good and much better than the typical airport fast food. I like the tacos.
Mashed potatoes with "Mexican" food? No beans or rice? Horchata that tasted flavorless. The guacamole had cranberries on it. Wtf?

This place is nicely decorated, staff was friendly and extremely overpriced, even for airport good/drinks. House margaritas are $10 and a chicken salad was $17 at the time of this entry. The food was flavorless and margaritas filled with mix. Save time and go somewhere else.

Three of us ate dinner here on Monday, March 10th at 7:30pm. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas, and my mother ordered the chicken burrito. WARNING: I popped a shrimp in my mouth and it was raw! They removed my entree from the bill. My mother got FOOD POISONING from her burrito!! (Which kicked in on our connecting flight!) my mother sent them a message on their website and they NEVER responded!!! With all my friends going to Arizona for spring training, I'm letting them all know to avoid this place like the plague!  PS: the food isn't cheap either!

Drinks are no bueno- chips are extra extra hard- even cut through my gum! Water came with no ice, asked for it twice. Mimosas had the nastiest orange juice ever and the Bloody Mary tasted disgusting. $13 guacomole has about 15 limes in it or tasted as it did.

So understanding I have only been here one time, you cannot (or can.. your choice) take my review as absolute fact.   The menu was rather on the small side, and while I THINK I saw it on some tables, I definitely didn't see it on the menu, and that is, chips and salsa. I dunno, maybe I have lived in El Paso for too long, but damn, chips and salsa? That's not even something you pay for, that's like automatic when you sit down... get with it Barrio.   This is one of very few places to eat in this particular terminal, so yea.. it was hella busy. But That is ok. We honestly didn't wait that long, and had 2 hrs to kill. So win-win I guess.   The menu was kinda small and kinda, I dunno how to put it, but it just wasn't like El Paso. If you've ever been to El Paso, you understand that its actually North Juarez. So yea, cant really get more "Mexican" than the Mexican food here... since we are in México. Anyways.... I ordered some tacos, they were OK.. the tortillas was fried or cooked or whatever.. kinda weird. They did have a bunch of tequila on hand, and many travelers seemed to be enjoying that.   Here you go, here is where all 3 stars came from: The freakin double churro and ice cream dessert I ordered. O_M_F_G dude.... so I ordered this dessert, it was basically 2 (rather large) churros, with cinnamon and chocolate powder on top, with this inside made of melted caramel, they were HOT... and they sat on a plate next to a generous scoop of vanilla bean ice cream and fresh strawberries. Now dude check it... I have had churros, from japan (yes they sell them there in movie theatres) to México, I have had some churros.... THIS, this random kinda ehhhh spot in a terminal at the Phoenix International (Sky Harbor) Airport... was the best churro dessert I have ever had. Honestly, the dessert alone was 4-5 stars, but the rest of the place 1-2 stars so it evens out at like 3.   I dunno, if you're in Phoenix, and in this terminal, why not try it out? But then again, why would anyone (voluntarily) be in phoenix?

Avoid this place. The wait was looonnngggg just to get out drink orders. The chips & salsa were stale & the salsa was bad. I brought this to the attention of the waitress & she told me the chips were not stale, they were just made from homemade corn tortillas. I get how chips work. They were stale.

Nothing edible for nonmeat eaters. The nachos (hold the charizo and the chicken) was just stale chips with honey mustard (for real) dressing on top. Gross. If they let a Taco Bell open up across the isle this place would be out of businesses

I hope maybe my visit was a sign that this place is turning around a bit. I went to Barrio in the airport on the way to NYC a couple weeks ago. I had the burrito with chicken and goat cheese and all sorts of yummyness inside. I thought it was very good! Very close to the quality of the food at their original restaurant. The service was a bit slow for an airport place, but that means you have to get there a bit earlier. The BF had the pulled pork torta and really enjoyed his food as well. I would say the cons include: expensive, not enough space between tables for a place in an airport...need a little space for luggage etc, and the service is slower than fast casual places (obviously). The pros, however, include: The food is very tasty, the ingredients in my food tasted fresh, they have tasty margaritas, and you're in the airport and not eating at pizza hut.....Hopefully the kinks will get worked out at this location and it can be just as successful as the location on 16th st.
Standard to slightly better corporate-style Mexican fare. Overpriced margaritas are probably the best thing about the Sky Harbor Intl Airport.

At first look this place looks bomb.  I ordered a Cadillac Margarita fir $14.25 and it came out in a glass the size of a shot glass.  Then it tasted like a horrible house Margarita.  Jack and coke was good though.  Then we got chips and salsa for $9.00. Chips had no taste and neither did the salsa.  I wouldn't bring my dog to eat here. Service was nice though.

If you're waiting for a flight at the Phoenix airport (and/or nervous to fly), the Barrio is a great spot for a margarita and liquid courage shot.  I've found myself at this bar twice now, and each time the margarita has been stellar (premium tequila, freshly squeezed lime juice, agave nectar, and Cointreau floater). Can't speak for the food, but the dishes that went past me looked tasty.  Special shout-out to the bartender who 86'd the drunk dude sitting next to me (he was already 6 beers deep!). That's not an easy situation to be in, and she handled it like a pro. I pity the folks who had to sit next to him on the plane.  Prices ain't exactly cheap (I believe my drink was around $12), but I guess that's pretty standard for an airport bar/restaurants. That being said, the Barrio is still a fun place to pass the time before boarding a flight.

Disappointing, even by airport standards. I ordered the breakfast sandwich to go. Although it's advertised as being served with chorizo, I barely found more than a few chunks... 1-2 ounces at most. The cheese was a poor attempt at being "melted." The bread was extremely chewy, like I had to use some strength to pull it apart with my teeth. The scrambled eggs and pico were the only redeeming components, but at $13.00 they were hardly worth it. Obviously the high standards that are applied at her other restaurants are not even a consideration at the airport location. Such a shame.

Five stars for food quality, variety, and atmosphere despite being in an airport. I am docking two stars for speed of service, price, and the general feeling that a portion of the wait staff were actually being held against their will. I felt genuinely forgot about in the latter part of our visit. This was, of course made up for, by the large quantity of butter packets that were thrust at me after requesting one. Otherwise, tasty stuff!

Service is sooooo slooooww. Waited 10 minutes to have someone ask if I wanted to order. Had 1 beer and nobody came back to check on me. Need my check & it's time to board the plane and nobody is here. It's an airport restaurant, people are usually in a hurry or need  to get on a flight at a specific time. Would be nice if the staff were more attentive.

Almost left because the description of the food was so different from what I expect at a Mexican food restaurant. I am so glad that I stayed! I had the nachos, which were definitely different from any nachos I have ever had before. They were so amazing I couldn't believe what I was eating.   If you give it a try, keep an open mind!

We just ate at Barrio at the Phoenix airport and went with the waitress recommendations. My husband had the french toast topped with spiced apples and ginger/ orange syrup and applewood bacon. I had a roasted poblano pepper filled with chicken and a fruit reduction drizzled with a cream sauce. Sides were zucchini and mashed potatoes with a flair. It was the beat food we have had in an airport and much better than many restaurants in Dallas where we live!  What an unexpected surprise!
Hire friendlier people for the front of the house.  Hosts were rude, and didn't even know what was on your own menu.

Meh, pretty much institutional food. My food was cold and just very average. I tried the chorizo and eggs. My wife's chilaquiles also had cold chips.  Breakfast potatoes sit in a tray pre cooked, back in the kitchen. Mine probably for hours.  Service is decent and friendly, and the place offers an ambience that's better than most because it sits in the newer nicer terminal D.

Not a fan. I had the Arizona Burrito, which was actually pretty bland. It came with some spicy fries and spicy ketchup, which was actually the best part of the meal.  Service was a bit slow. Took about 15 minutes to actually receive my beer and wasn't offered a second one til I was about done with my meal.

Great cocktails!  Dont worry food comes fast! I know, pricey, but Barrio Cafe is a Phoenix staple rated one of the best reateraunts in the state.  This airport extended location will get you the basics with the limitted menu.  The guacamole made fresh is one of their signatures. If you cant decide between tacos and something else choose tacos.   The service at this location is great. One of the people in our party asked for ranch dressing which they dont have. The manager went to the resteraunt next door and got it with no questions asked even though we told him it was no big deal (props to la grande orange).  If you're in Phoenix go to the original location, if you have a layover in Terminal D go here.
As far as airport food is concerned, this is about as good as it gets! Great service and excellent fish tacos.

This place has plenty of potential, the premiss is good - latino food in PHX Airport, decor is good, menu is varied and has tempting items. The waitstaff has improved and attentive and interested. The manager is very nice. The reason I met the manager is the food. Ordered the Chilies en Nogada - a poblano pepper filled w/chicken,dried fruits, pears, apples in almond creme sauce. Execution is the problem, dark brown food in a nice soft pepper with light tan sauce and big red cranberries and dried cilantro leaves. Chicken was overcooked! Why didn't they use fresh cilantro? The favors could have been great but I think they are trying too high a scale of cuisine for the location. A smaller menu of all fresh food would not embarrass the chef/owner. P. S. Because of a 2hr delay, I tried the Flan, it was very tasty, but the strawberries were not ripe...

The green pozole was really good. Happy to see an authentic Mexican soup recipe anywhere, let alone an airport restaurant. Yum. Pozole gets 5 stars. However......This one star was for the service and the guacamole.  My fiancé and I happen to have noticed that we were sitting next to a semi-famous rock musician at lunch (yes, here at the airport). No big deal to us, really, but our server became VERY star-struck when he noticed and was so giddy and distracted. He lingered at the rock star table, and was trying to engage him in conversation constantly. It was really annoying and our service suffered big time.   The guacamole on the menu stated it was made table side by your server, which is always awesome, so we ordered it. Needless to say we were VERY surprised when our shameless server boy quickly dropped off a small bowl of Pre-made guacamole instead of fresh guacamole made table side. Ohhhhhh K.......It's also covered in pomegranate seeds. Not exactly easy to eat as the seeds are not meant for consumption (just the red juicy part around them). It was straight up sour! Soaked in lime juice, and absolutely salty. Disappointing and gross.   I think a restaurant that advertises expensive table side guacamole should actually MAKE table side guacamole. That way there's no chance of F'ing it up with too much lime or funky pomegranate seeds. I also think focused, attentive waitstaff is a must. Barrio cafe just doesn't cut it. Get a better overpriced meal further inside the airport terminal.

Bartenders here are quick and have friendly personalities.... One of the fellas who I talked to last week remembered me and my drink! I didn't eat last time but love the Conchita pibil... They have everything come in from the commissary so I'll update in a few.... They make sangria on site

Good food! Had the fish tacos and they were pretty awesome. Salad on the side was fresh. Drinks, awesome except for the fact that for a Mexican place I'd say they should have more than one random Mexican beer on tap. Waitress... Umm... In general the staff was below standard and quite interesting but service was at standard at least. I'll be back next time I'm here!

I was starving after a day of traveling and after traversing every gate in the airport, I settled on this place with my usual amount of heavy skepticism.  I mean really, airport food?  Ugh.  Well this time I made a good decision because I was actually impressed.  The service was friendly, although not the fastest because one of the people behind the scenes misplaced my food for a couple of minutes.  But the counter person realized this pretty quickly and went to find my shrimp tacos as soon as she saw that I was still hanging around.  Four shrimp tacos and a bottled water for $16 seems about right for airport food, and this food was good!  I even liked the seasoned fries, and I rarely like seasoned fries.  I'm going to keep this one on my list since I actually seem to hit the Phoenix airport a couple times a year.

Well I guess they must have read some of the reviews as I got a great lunch - fresh guacamole (one of best I've had) and great beer-battered shrimp tacos. None of the complaints about poor service apply - can't complain. Was in and out in about 30 mins at around 1pm on a weekday.

It's Monday Oct 17th @7:30am.  I've been sitting being quite waiting for my yogurt parfait (it doesn't need to be cooked). It still takes 35 min for it because she said she forgot to put it in. The bartender (Teri) keeps busy. Then she starts hollering at the servers while I'm sitting at her bar. This is rude. She says how it's her first day back from vacation and she's struggling. That's fine, but be nice to your coworkers. The granola parfait wasn't that. It was a fruit plate with yogurt and a dusting of granola. Disappointing.   On another not there's an older gentlemen who seems to be her bar back. He does her job of making sure everyone's takin care of. He's nice. Made sure I had silverware because she only gave me a spoon. He makes small talk. He makes her money. I hope she knows this!

I'm not sure how this place only has 3 stars, maybe travelers into Phoenix are used to the type of Mexican food served at Chilis.  I had the carne asada a la ricardo and the IPA on tap. The food was excellent, not too spicy but enough spice to linger throughout and cause a few sniffles. It was a generous helping of meat with sautéed onions, tomatoes, garlic and fresh cut jalapeños (not pickled) served with steak fries and the house salsa and spicy ketchup.  I'm a native Phoenician, and I've been missing proper southwest flavor since I moved to northern Cali and this delivered while I waited for my flight back home. It's a little pricey, but it's airport food and I am leaving satisfied, so I'm not going to subtract for that.  Apparently this restaurant has been around in south Phoenix for a while, I'm going to make it a point to stop in next time I'm here.

Came in with my mom with over an hour before our flight. Unfortunately it seems like they sat a lot of people in our waitresses section within a short amount of time because the service was terrible!   Two different groups of people near us got their food before us even though they were seated and ordered after us. Our waitress eventually told us there was a mix up with our order in the kitchen but by that time we had to get our food to-go or miss our flight! We had to ask multiple servers for to-go boxes and our check because each would dismiss our efforts to get their attention. We also saw another woman eating a taco while exiting the restaurant because she was going to miss her flight and her friend had to pay her check.  Thankfully, they only charged us for our drinks because of the inconvenience but we will not be returning the next time we are at the airport.

As far as airport food goes this was pretty good. I had the pork tacos with the side salad instead of the fries. First of all for $12 it was a ton of food. (Fyi my meal was cheap but everything else besides the tacos and burritos were spendy) The tacos were street taco sized but there were 4 of them and the salad serving was pretty generous. The salad was delish and I suspect a lot of it had to do with the cheese. It was unlike anything I've ever had. It's like a cross between a mild goat cheese and cottage cheese. The dressing was really light on the greens too which was great after a weekend of horrible eating. The tacos were really tasty too. On the salty side but the marinade was good and the pork was really tender. Topped with a pico de gallo and more of the cheese. I actually really enjoyed it. Though I ended up scarfing it down like a starving coyote since my first flight got in a little late and it took me a while to order. There is nothing else really for food in this terminal but regardless I would probably stop here again. I would just make sure I had more time to enjoy.  I should note I sat at the bar. This is not for the to-go window.

I love, love, the margaritas and food. I purposely show up at the airport 2 hrs early since usually depart out of Gate C. Seriously the best airport restaurant for food and drink. Best of all I, the food and beverages are the same price as the other airport restaurants.

If you're looking for the slowest service imaginable, why don't you stop on by. I would have ordered food but didn't care to wait. The service staff is rude and I couldn't believe the amount of BS it takes to order a beer. Bad form Barrio, get your act together.
I couldn't believe how good this place is and it's inside an airport! I searched out their place in Phoenix, off the hook too!

I realize this locale is at the airport, so I'll be gracious. But friends, this ain't The Barrio Café you'll find downtown. The food is really terrific for airport food, the service is mediocre, but it's still the airport. The really bright spot was the tableside guacamole that seems similar to the original locale. Chips were okay too, but how can you screw up tortilla chips? The rest of our meal was average at best. I'm looking forward to trying you again and giving you the benefit of my doubts!

My husband and I stopped here during our layover in Phoenix... I was super excited since I've eaten at the regular Barrio Cafe location in Phoenix, but unfortunately this was a major disappointment!  The service was slow, our waitress was pretty unfriendly, only 2/3 of my husbands tacos had meat, my nachos were ice cold (on top of not really being good in the first place).  Top all of that off with probably the worst tasting margaritas we've ever had.  All the other tables around us all said theirs were lousy, too!  All in all a bad experience. Walk to Terminal C instead!
Nasty to-go chicken burrito.  It was  boiled chicken in a gravy rolled in a flour tortilla.  yecch.

The service here was prompt and friendly.   Our drink order was taken and delivered quickly.   These are things I look for in airport establishments!    Our waitress was helpful in describing menu items we had questions about.   We ended up ordering both the fish tacos and the steak tacos. Neither was bad, but I wouldn't eat here again as I was not "wowed."  The French fries were blah. The tacos were meh. The best part about our meal was our adult bevvys (cold and refreshing).   Honestly, I've never had more mediocre food. I expected more from Barrio Cafe, but I won't be back again.    I look for oomph or at least a mouthful of flavor when I'm eating Mexican food. This just didn't do it for me.   I honestly think I'd be happier eating a prepackaged sandwich than what I had here.   With other amazing options in this terminal, there's no reason for me to return.
Menu seemed to try hard for Mexican food so I went over to Taquitos at Gate C for street tacos. No regrets.

The coffee is good for the price.  The breakfast potatoes look & taste like they were made yesterday.  The bacon is really good!  The waiter sat two people right next to me.  You know, uncomfortably close & in my space.  There was plenty of seating elsewhere.  I initially had a server that said "My coffee isn't working today" making me think they couldn't serve coffee.  Then she explained the coffee she drank hadn't kicked in yet.  OK?  I overheard her tell the same story to another table thus confusing them about the coffee.  That story isn't working, stop telling it.  It's 7:00 AM and we are here for coffee.  Maybe she was new?  My table was sticky.  Next time I'll order a side of bacon and fruit.
Good service, good food but expensive - can't expect cheap food in an airport! Will continue grabbing my pre-flight food at the Phoenix's Barrio!
